review: Have not had RR in maybe 3 years.   Went in there. The hostess took about a minute to show up and then we got seated about 5 min after that.    It is what it is.   The food was great for this caliber of a spot.  I mean ya 15 bucks for a burger seems high but it was angus beef and I guess that's the new norm.  The service was great too.  Would come
All American. Keep coming back. We love the sweet potatoe fries and royal burgers. Sharing makes us happy.... the food serving sizes are definitely worthy of Sharing! Service and food are our style.

Red Robin can work in a pinch, I... guess?  You know the scene: sticky menus, screaming suburban children with their jaded parents and 20-something patrons clamoring for their free birthday Burger. Tustin's Red Robin is no different than yours and that is down to the American flag made out of baseballs. The options will not surprise you, but you can get lost in the sheer volume of different offerings (I counted 3 unique Bleu Cheese Burgers alone). The service is pedestrian and the prices border ludicrous (upwards of $15.00 these days).  One huge gripe I have is with the meat temperature choices. You have two: some pink or grey. That is really dumbing it down for your kitchen. If you can't count on your cook to figure out medium rare why did you hire the person to begin with? On to the Burger... I went with "The finest Black & Bleu Burger" (sans mushrooms) that is billed as "A true knife-and-fork burger" that they serve without... you guessed it... a fork. Or a knife.  A half pound Black Angus patty is dusted with blackening seasoning and then seared to "some pink" then topped with caramelized onions, a tangy Bleu cheese sauce and huge Bleu cheese chunks then given the wilted lettuce and toasted and sponge -like ciabatta bun treatment along with Dijon sauce. The Burger was "somewhat juicy" instead of "some pink" although the Bleu Cheese to blackening seasoning ratio really was spot on. Red Robin suggests eating the Burger with a Sam Adams. I would recommend the Ballast Point Sculpin IPA instead.  The Fries are greasy on the outside, dry and starchy within... but hey, you get all you can eat.  One Burger, Fries and the aforementioned Sculpin IPA will set you back about $30.00 after tax and tip. At that cost, I can't justify 3 stars even if they would cook it to order. Grab your ankles and bite down hard people, this is going to hurt.

Always great service and great food. We had a slight mishap with one of the dishes but not only was it corrected fast, the manager came over to make sure we were good. I dont think we have ever gone wrong coming here for dinner!

Wasn't the best experience went for lunch waited forever for our food! The burger was tiny compared to the other Red Robin's I've been to. Then they proceeded to bring my guacamole burger out with seriously a smidgen of guacamole. We asked for some lemonade to go, paid the check waited 10 mins and decided screw it! Plus it wasn't that busy.

Red Robin has a great selection of burgers.  You can mix and match toppings, and they have many choices for sauces and buns.  I like their bottomless fries, which can be regular or garlic; they even have sweet potato fries.  My favorite sauce is Bacon aioli.  It tastes like Chic-fil-a's secret sauce but with real bacon pieces, if you don't know it's like a honey mustard mixed with a BBQ sauce - don't knock it till you try it. Try it on the crispy chicken sandwich; you won't be sorry!  They're grilled chicken is quite tasty too.  Their burgers can be regular ground beef, Angus or veggie. Even if you know what kind of burger you like typically, you will find yourself saying, "that's probably good" and spending a little longer perusing the menu options.

This is our family go-to restaurant because of the selection and value.   Week days are not a problem to get seated quickly but expect a wait on the weekends...that's IF you can find a parking spot. The little computer screens on the tables allow you to conveniently order appetizers or shakes, and it allows for a quick check-out.  No more waiting for the server to come back! Food is good. We haven't hit anything yet that the kids didn't like. Service has been great on all of our visits. I noticed all the random artwork is off the walls, giving it a cleaner feel.

1 star for the good food. 0 stars for poor service.  We waited at the front door for 10 minutes and nobody came to seat me and my buddy. This happened twice. Not going there again.  Many waiters and staff walked by and they just ignored. 2 waiters looked at us a few times from deep inside the restaurant and got back to their chit chat. First time we went there service was ok till when it came to paying the bill. Waiter asked us to pay using the little ipad gadget that sits on the table. Its user interface is just a poor design.  When paying it says "swipe card". And you go ahead and swipe your credit card. But it is asking for red robin rewards card. And from that screen its annoying to figure out how to pay your bill. Waitress came and shows a little attitude saying you guys couldn't figure how to pay the bill blah blah... I was stupid to go back second time to this location.  Management is poor.  Ciao!
Service was great, everyone was super nice, the food was fantastic,Yummy solid meat tasty burgers severs are all good and friendly..management,,,,,come and eat here, you will not be disappointed!!!!

Service was horrible. Walked in and the hostess couldn't even say hi. Told her how many in party and just took us to a table. Waitress comes over 10 min later to take drink order. Beer, water and lemonade. Then she comes back to take order without drinks. Husband orders appetizer and hamburger and she goes do you want to order the main course, um isn't that what we are doing. Never got refilled French fries and had to ask for Refill water and lemonade and beer. Delivered  beer but not the other drinks had to ask her again and she was clueless. The place was not even busy. I will rethink going to this place again. The past has always been good experience. Now we wait for the bill

Red Robin is has a pretty standard menu.  Their burgers are nothing to write home about.  Since I've cut red meat out and this was the place we decided on to have lunch, I opted for their 'other' burger - Crispy Cod.  Not bad but not great either.  The bun was much too thick but very soft and pillowy.  I enjoyed the bottomless herb garlic fries - which I think are new.  It is definitely a place I would not choose to go to but a place I was able to find a non-meat option.  No picture as I devoured my food.  Sorry folks...  As for vegans, I don't think this is a viable option as their is tarter sauce on the cod sammy ad the herb garlic fries had parmesan on them.  An overall decent experience but the food is definitely not the reason to be going to RR.

We go to that Red sometimes and decided to order take out since I'm sick and didn't feel like going out ! Let me tell  you that everything I asked for on the phone we didn't get :(( when placing my order I asked that my husband's guacamole burger have extra guacamole and that my A1 burger have extra sauce and guess what, both of the burgers where sooooo dry :((( we ordered one of the burgers to be some pink and the other no pink but both burgers were burned !!! And finally I asked for 2 sides of ranch 2 times and she promised me that she would not forget and guess what NO ranch !!!! Overall a bad bad lunch :((( will not ever be ordering from that Red Robin again !!!!

My party of 18 and I made a reservation at 6:15 and we have been waiting almost 1 HOUR NOW. The manager is doing ABSOLUTELY NOTHING. So now we are standing in the front, CROWDING everything. Members of our group even had to go to the table and ask the table to move. The workers here do nothing and we feel like we are put LAST. Bad service, bad experience, overall BAD.

Not as good as I remember Red Robin being. Burger was just okay, salads were meh, the wait took a really long time. It didn't seem as though there were enough waiters, quite frankly. They had this new screen thing where you can place orders, which is pretty cool, but that didn't mean things went faster.  If you're looking at the happy hour thing on the screen though, beware. It says all day every day, but you will not be getting that price all day every day. Apparently they changed their happy hour but have yet to change it on the screen thing. Yes, you may be excited when you see that and order some beers. Yes, you'll be confused as to why those beers cost so much at the end. Yes, you'll ask your waiter and he'll refer you to the manager. Yes, the manager will explain that the screen is wrong. Fortunately, I was able to talk to the manager and we ended up getting discounted a little bit, but wow that sucked.  This location...not worth. Perhaps we shall try a different location in the future.
Good service, good vibes and amazing burgers! Will definitely be back at this location.

Food did not match pic; all of our fries were cold; server was serving many tables seemingly working by herself; never had a bad experience st any other Red Robin; manager or bus person not present; our server was overwhelmed

Another Red Robin location with the all the crazy crap on the walls and their biggest selling point: bottomless steak fries! Because of that alone, Red Robin cements attention among the vast competition for places to go when the burger craving hits. This location feels exactly like every other location to me. The only thing that's changed is that I can't eat as many baskets of fries as I once was able to. Sad right? Still, service was fine no problems in order and wait time. We were outta there with gusto as well since we used the table top payment machine. What a breeze!

For lunch? Arrive between 11:50am and 12:10pm to avoid the huge crowds! I like their bottomless fries and freckled lemonade! So dangerous yet so good.  I had their Whiskey bbq burger and it was not at all what I would expect in a bad way.  I could not taste the Whiskey bbq in any way...I think next time I'll get something with bacon.  I opened a new rewards account with them and hope to keep track every time.

The food is great but the service not so much. I came in the other day and first it took for ever just to get our drinks in, it was so long we almost left and we only wanted water! then when we ordered our food (there was only two of us) and we ordered the most simple thing in my opinion that took forever as well! But I do have to say the burger was AMAZING and the server was nice despite her time management, maybe she was having an off day. All in all-good food, service okay.

My boyfriend and I came in late last night, we both had a really long day at work so just needed a quick bite. As we came in there was no host because it was late which I understand, I noticed there was a girl finishing up and wrapping up food it looked like at one of the pos stations. She saw us standing there and I thought okay cool she will let someone know we are waiting because she was already cut.  Well she walked right past us and out the door no acknowledgment or letting one of her co workers know we were up there. I understand your off but your still wearing the uniform so the least you could do is let someone know, or maybe even take the extra 30 seconds to seat us.  So we are still waiting another serving was walking around and saw us from the far pos station, he grabbed an order of  onion rings and walked right past us, and again I made eye contact with Him and figured ok he is going to drop those off to his table and come back for us right?  Yeah he did the exact opposite and walked the other way so he wouldn't have to talk to us or seat us. What amazing customer service this location has  At this point I was really upset and wanted to leave but my boyfriend suggested we just go and sit at the bar.  The bartender was really attentive, he had a couple tables in the dining area as well and seemed to be a hard worker. I didn't catch his name but he was really nice and provided great service.  Luckily for me I did catch the servers name who ignored us his name is Andrew... next time please just take the time to acknowledge your customers we help pay your bills!  nobody likes to be ignored especially when we were the ONLY people standing there looking like idiots waiting to be seated.

Hadn't been to a Red Robin's in years, but since they were supporting the community and Special Olympics we have it a try. My Teriyaki Cheeseburger was spot on. My wife felt her mushroom/swiss burger was a little overcooked. The meatballs meal for my grandson was devoured, so I know he liked it! Fries were OK- I am not a big fan of "steak fries", but they were piping hot. I would come here again.

I've been coming to this red robin since its opening. It's nice, clean, rather quiet, and a majority of times have great service. But the past few months I've been getting terrible service from multiple servers. I hope they can bring back the good old vibes it once had.

I placed a to-go order, and it was what you would expect. They were pretty fast, and the food was good. I ordered the BBQ Chicken Wrap, Clucks & Fries, a Coke, and a Salted Caramel Shake. When I went to pick the order up my shake wasn't ready yet. I waited by the bar, and noticed a server eating out of a cup behind the bar. I thought she must be on her break. Then I noticed her walk closer to me and pour the same cup into a plastic to-go cup...It was my Salted Caramel milkshake! lol... I was kind of annoyed because I paid for that. It's kind of comical. It was more an annoyance than anything else, but oh well!

Boyfriend and I decided to step away from the Asian food for once to go on a classic date with burgers and milkshakes! Plus, the idea of bottomless fries sounded amazing. We waited about 15 minutes on a Saturday night to be seated, which wasn't bad at all considering there's an Ulta across the street. Once we were seated, we decided to order a monster oreo milkshake to share ($4.99), and I went with the Sir Acha Tavern Double ($6.99) while my boyfriend went with the A1 Peppercorn ($11.49).  The food came out at a relatively normal speed for an American restaurant, and our burgers came before the shake. My burger was pretty meh-- didn't taste sriracha at all, and it pretty much tasted like a bland fast food burger. Please hit your meat with some more seasoning. Also, the buns for their burgers aren't toasted. WHYY? Toasted buns are a much better vehicle for transferring the food into your mouth and would have added another level of very needed texture. Was sad to say that my boyfriend's burger was also pretty bland even though it was listed in the gourmet section. Buns were also not toasted, which just confuses me. However, everything else was good! The steak fries were really crispy and good, which was a surprise since they are endless. We ended up getting each of our fries refilled twice although we were unable to finish the second round. The server was extremely nice, however, and let us take the leftovers home. The shake was also good although it does not allow unlimited refills. You get the normal size glass and a metal cup with some extra shake to refill your first glass with. Overall, the burgers were average but our experience was pretty good. Will likely be back again when we're craving that classic diner experience again.

Red Robin always comes through whenever I want that upscale diner environment. I ordered one of their new burgers, the Chimin Fresco burger. It was okay because I wasn't a fan of the bun but everything else was amazing. I also order the short stack onion tower. Plus lots of bottomless fries and lots of campfire sauce. Love it all LOTS.

Had lunch with my sweetheart here today. The cooks must have had an off day today. We normally get a good meal here and today my wife's meal came out wrong. My Burger was bland and the cheese was not even melted on my Burger!! The first order of fries came out cool. Wad to ask for refills on our drinks and then wait awhile until filled. The only reason I give the 2 stars today is that the second order of fries came out crisp and piping hot and my wife was given a 50% discount on her meal. We will come back and hopefully be able to give this store a better review in the future.

Brian was an amazing server!! Checked on us multiple times to make sure we were happy and brought our food out fast. Food tasted amazing. Told them we were splitting food and they brought it out on two different plates, I love that.

I came here this week to meet a friend for an early evening bite to eat. The server was very attentive at the beginning but appeared to be a little pushy. We were here at 4:15 and there were maybe less than 10 people in the whole place. W ordered the caesar salad with some pretzel bites (they were so yummy) and the salad was just so so. As the restaurant started to get busier we had trouble finding our server when ready to leave as we wanted to place a to go order. Overall the experience was ok and I am grateful there are still some restaurants out there where you can still order a variety of items but I really prefer the Costa Mesa/South Coast Plaza location much better. No doubt this is a decent place at lunchtime for the location. Quality is average.

Red Robin has decent burgers. Nothing too special but I do like the concept of bottomless fries and adding a runny egg to my burger. The place was practically empty when I dined, but I'm sure it's crowded during high peak dinner hours and on the weekends. The service is okay, and the prices are comparable for establishments of its kind. It is shared parking with many other businesses at the District so it can be challenging to find a parking spot during high peak hours.

I came to eat food and this place did not disappoint. Inside the restaurant, they have menus. On these menus are different options for food, one of which I chose. When the food arrived, I ate it. After finishing the food, I gave them money and went home. Five stars!

If you're going to make a customer wait for over 30 minutes, your food better be hot and delicious! Unfortunately, neither the food nor the service was up to par at Red Robin. Our server and manager separately came out to tell us that our food was "almost ready." But we ended up waiting ANOTHER 20 minutes for our food. They said the kitchen was backed up for 40 minutes. How? The restaurant was half full and most of the customers already had their food. The food itself was very underwhelming. My burger patty wasn't even warm. The first batch of endless fries were cold and stale. We asked for a second round, and those fries were better. Overall, my experience was extremely disappointing. I am not inspired to eat at Red Robin in the foreseeable future.

Meh, always underwhelmed with the service and food at this location. I prefer the Spectrum location over this one at least... this past visit the service was slow and we had to ask other servers nearby to get us refills on fries. Service got slightly better at the end but this was after we were finished eating and waiting on other stuff like a milkshake. In our service area there was only one waiter working when there probably should have been at least one more. It was late afternoon so I get it: it should be slow... but if it starts picking up, people need to step in and help. I just didn't see this. Food was OK otherwise - garlic herb fries just tasted too greasy overall. The prime chophouse burger also tasted slightly greasy but good enough to pass? Definitely not as fresh or hot as I would have expected. I think we'll just stick with the Spectrum location moving forward - we haven't consistently had mediocre/bad experiences there versus other locations.
Came to the bar for a burger and margarita. Bar was full for the football game but Jamar took excellent care of me. My drinks and food came out in very short time. Thanks Jamar!

So you kind of assume that Red Robins are going to be consistent wherever you go, and low and behold, they pretty much are. However, this one actually had good service. As anyone who frequents Red Robin in the bay area knows, service is usually lousy. So, it was kind of nice to get a good tasting burger with good service. It's one of the few times I actually got to taste a piping hot burger as I swear they usually sit somewhere before they get to my table up in the bay area.  Unlimited fries, ranch dressing, and well cooked tasty burgers. Can't go wrong!

This was a bad mix of good and bad.  First the good.. Server was very friendly and attentive. She listened or seemed to listen.  Then it went downhill. Ordered a burger, meat and cheese only. No pink. Arrived slightly pink, with onions, pickles and tomatoes. Ordered a side salad with the burger.  Food presentation was pleasing.  She brought my dining companion utensils but did not bring me any. I had a salad with my lettuce wrapped burger. burger. She brought a total of two napkins. His food was cooked properly but I noted he didn't finish it. He said it just wasn't that great.  She offered to refill drinks several times. She had half the service part perfect but seemed distracted. She was super duper sweet and personable, she needs a bit more seasoning at the job.  Check was brought, receipt sent home had no breakdown, just a total paid. We paid and left, it was getting busy and we were tired. I won't go back here.

This Red Robin was an overall disappointment. We had a reservation at 6:30 and didn't get seated until about 7:05. Our waitress was very friendly and got us our drinks quickly, which was redeeming to a degree. The Food-Network-inspired burger I got tasted more like burnt hair with cheese and sauce than a gourmet burger. Poor show.

This is a Red Robin in the District. Parking in the District where their physical location is bad, so I walked over from a less busy parking lot. I came here to pick up a takeout order for my friend, and one picks up the orders from the bar. It took a short time to get someone to walk over to have the order processed but I got it done. The location is a PokéStop too.

It's a chain burger place, what do you expect? I don't come here very often, but every time has been consistent. I've gotten the Prime Chophouse the past couple of times, to-go, and it was good. Nothing too special. The best part was the crispy onion straws; it fit right in with the burger! Service has always been ok. This location is at The District, which means horrible parking. Find a spot somewhere towards the middle, and just walk to Red Robin. Beats the hassle of trying to find a close spot, unless you're lucky and got a spot without actually looking for one. All in all, I'll probably come back, but it's more like a once a year, or twice a year kind of thing. I'd rather go to a non-chain burger place for my burger and fry fix.

Halfway through a fork of broccoli, my friend noticed there were bugs in it! Like a lot of bugs, not just one. Management comped my meal but told me corporate would get back to me the same day, which wasn't true, I got a call days after. Only time I've had broccoli at a red robins and my last.

This is a to go review... I ordered food from here twice in the same night. The first time I got it-they forgot the soup. No worries- I'll order again. This time I get it- the soup bowl is half full and they put the tortillas in it so by the time I got to it they were soggy and disgusting. I don't know what was going on in their to go area tonight but you guys really dropped the ball

In recent years, Red Robin has been trying to update and make their menu more interesting.  They have added more burgers and different items to order, but I still just prefer the classic burgers.   My favorite things to order are the Royal Red Robin burger with a strawberry lemonade.  Of course, the fries are bottomless and if you want to pig out they'll keep bringing them nice and hot.

My wife and I had a very bad experience with this location. I ordered food to go and was told to pick up within 30 minutes. I had a meeting to attended and I made sure to let the person know that 30 min is fine but to make sure the food is ready.  After arriving there, I was told that the order was not ready and one of the items I ordered was not available. I told them why didn't they call and notify me. They told me that the number I called to place the order with was a third party and not on location. So basically they were not responsible. I asked them why isn't my food ready? They said that they were waiting for me to call so that I can order a different item to replace the one item they were out at the time. The item we are talking about was doughnuts and had nothing to do with them not preparing the two other entrees I ordered.  So basically my order was not ready, took an hours vs the 30 minutes I was promised. I took the food and come to find they also messed up on the order. I asked for fries but they gave  me something else.  My wife and I had a meeting that night and wanted to eat before the meeting. We ended up waiting until the meeting was over three hours later and the food was already cold.  We ended up throwing it away.  I asked to speak to the store manager and explained to him the situation when I was there. He said the same thing that the number we called to place the order with was not on location and that it was a thirds party and all he can say was sorry.  I am very disappointed and feel like I have been cheated and ripped off by this restaurant. Not only they messed up on my order, they also made me wit 30 extra minutes and when I finally opened the bags, the order was wrong.  What upset me the most is we tried to explain to the manager what had happened and instead of him offering us a refund, he instead pointed fingers blaming the ordering department that they messed up. I told him what about the delay of 30 minutes which made us late to our meeting. His response was and I quote, " I'm sorry but we are so packed as you see and mistakes do happen." This is very upsetting to have a manager say something like this to us. Very bad customer service. We have a corporation and we usually take our employees to eat there all the time. Due to this incident we have decided to take our business somewhere else. One more important thing, I tried to call corporate and was given the run arounds. It's always voice mail and they never returned my call.  I don't recommend this restaurant to anyone. Save your money and  stay away from this place. Very unprofessional and dishonest people.

I used to go here a lot. The service is always great. Wait staff always on point. Food is usually pretty good too. The main reason I go to Red Robin is for a nice fried egg on my burger. For some reason the cook here has no clue how to fry an egg without over cooking the yolk. The whole point of getting a fried egg on anything is for that extra dimension of flavor once the yolk is broken.

*This post is for the food only* I don't think I've ever written a bad review before and am always pretty open minded about good or bad food, but today our food experience was nasty. Wings were dry and flavorless, I asked for buffalo sauce on the side and it was watery and extremely oily. Burger was sloppy, oily and flavorless. Food was just not good. Never coming back. 50 bucks not well spent.  James our server was super nice and attentive. :)
Great service  Ask for Amber  She's very quick, pays attention to detail  Endless root beer floats

I have visited this location quite a number  of times,  each time the service was a hit or miss.  Lately, the service was beyond piss poor. I attempted to place an online order and link my rewards account, however the system was down. I called in and asked if I placed my order online whether or not I would be able to still earn points for my purchase. A team member told me all I had to do is provide my phone number when picking up my order and I would be credited the points. Upon arriving for my order and providing my phone number, I was told that unfortunately  I was given incorrect information. I would have to void the online order,  and re-order.  I was told that the online order when voided, would not post to my account and would "fall off". In good faith I paid for the order again. I noticed about 2 days after my visit,  I was charged for 2 purchases instead of one. I called in to find out how I could be refunded for the additional charge. I was told I had to wait for a manager to reach out to corporate, because Red Robin's system reflected I had not actually been charged. I peovided detailed information i.e transaction number, date and etc to substantiate the fact I had been charged. I was repeatedly told over the many days I called to follow up I had not been charged. After much persistence, I was finally told I was charged and should be credited within the next 2 days.   I waited the 2 days,  no refund. This went on for about 2 plus weeks. I had to finally call my bank to file a dispute.  Foolish of me to return, after a friend of mine wanted to. Against my judgement I did, and the service was HORRIBLE!! I ordered online and arrived within the 12 minutes as advised. I waited  for more than 30 minutes. I finally arrived home and discovered all the toppings on my burger was gone. I was livid. I called corporate and was treated even worse. The representative repeatedly called me outside of my name. When I corrected him,  he still continued. He was nonchalant or unconcerned with the poor treatment I experienced. He promised he would ensure I received a follow up call from a general manager.  Lets just say, I never received a follow up call! Do  NOT give them your business.  They do NOT value their customers, and are liars and thiefs.

I've been coming to to Red Robin forever.  My kids have loved it since they were small.  I will admit its been awhile since I've been here.  They have redone everything.  I'm not a fan of the new menu.  The food left much to be desired.   I wasn't wow'ed.  We are not in a hurry to come back.  The best part of the experience is my friend got to watch his Raiders game.
Along with amazingggg bottomless fries there is Andrew, a warm, bubbly, and attentive server who made our dinning experience great. Feel like he knew our needs before we did! Thanks Andrew!

Q: I cannot consume lettuce and cheese/dairy and just ordered the souper and sandwich. Let's see if they get my order right. A: Yes, they did get my order right, but I think the sauce they used in the bbq chicken wrap was made with buttermilk mixed with bbq sauce. It tasted great, but... If you're lactose intolerance, don't order it. I should have asked what was in that sauce! Service was on point and now you can pay and play at your table thanks to kiosks.

Worst Service Ever! We literally sat down to an empty bar and received zero service not even acknowledged even though there was managers, bar tenders and waiters passing by for over 10 mins we got up and left. I would give them zero stars if it allowed me to.

Just had dinner here tonight. We came in around 6:30 and had a 15-20 minute wait. Nice staff and fun games in the waiting area, but more seats are needed. Once seated we were greeted by our server, Andrew. He was very friendly and prompt. He quickly got us started with drinks and appetizers. Only issue was he forgot to bring us our silverware and napkins until we were finger deep in our chili chili cheese fries. I see this as an issue with the establishment, I think all tables should have those ready before seating. Andrew seemed to be handling the entire part of the dining area of 8-10 tables himself. Refilled our drinks and food came quick. We really enjoyed the BLT sandwich and the bbq whiskey chicken sandwich. Prices are great, good servings, friendly service. Only recommendations are more seats in waiting area and have silverware ready before seating someone.

Waiter was very professional food was good.   I like the fact that their fries are really tasty, but they are all u can eat !!!!  Party of 5 ate for $62.00 one good coupon and one child meal.  A little pricey bit overall a great time

I come here probably 2-3 times a month. I like to try different burgers here. They have a variety of unique burgers at what I feel is a decent price.  Today i had the Royal Red Robin burger. It was DELICIOUS!!!  It was not the first time I have had it. I take the top bun off and eat it with a knife and fork. I slathered Tapatio all over  the egg. I break the egg yolk open and let it ooze all over the burger. Perfect. With the thick  hickory bacon. Pure awesomeness.  I would give it a 5 but I hate HATE HATE the parking situation (Tustin the District)  here during lunch. I know that's no fault of RR but it does make a difference sometimes if I go there or not.

Red Robin overall is a 3 star for me, but this location has now failed me 3 times in a row.  Highlights for my 3 visits: - slow seating - slow greeting by server - attitude from server when it was clear we were waiting almost 10 minutes to get asked for our drink order.  - sad flimsy fries instead of fresh ones - no manager to be found Ill stick to the south coast location as I've had better luck there.

Went for lunch on Sunday. Took over an hour to get our food after ordering. Ordered the Royal Burger - burger w a sunny side up egg & bacon. The egg was uncooked on top, all gooey and somehow they also managed to pop the yolk and it had dropped out on the plate. How do you mess up an egg?? Never coming back.

Back in the day, ah those good old high school days, Red Robin was one of the places for me to get delicious burgers. After a couple years of hiatus from Red Robin, I have to say that the quality of the food is still consistent, albeit there are a slight few changes. We ordered: 1. Royal Red Robin ($10.79): your basic cheeseburger with that fried egg added to the burger. Burger was delicious and the fried egg brought flavor to the selection overall. It comes with bottomless fries too! (5/5) 2. Arctic Cod Fish & Chips ($12.99): comes with four crispy fried fish with bottomless fries. The tartar sauce was good. Definitely ask for their malt vinegar for that extra *pizzazz* to the fish! (5/5) Overall, the food was delicious. I noticed that the amount of fries they give you per serving has definitely gotten smaller, but at least they haven't gotten rid of their trademark "bottomless fries." But other than that, service was kind of slow but our server was nice.

For my first visit, it sucks! Manager refused to honor advertised web specials, there's no happy hour although its stated there is, drink is so sweet i wanted to send back n the server rarely visited our table. Only good thing is bottomless fries!. NEVER AGAIN!

Update: Better food and better service this time. We had an awesome waiter who brought our food quickly and made sure we had everything we needed the entire meal. Food was good. I ordered a Mexican chicken platter with salad.
Great service, Tim was very engaged and made sure that we had everything we needed, we never had to wait for him or call him as he was very observant.  Great job. Place was also very clean.

Let me start off by saying "I LOVE RED ROBIN" it's a fantastic place to eat and I love going there as much as I can for fantastic burgers and endless fries.  That being said this red robin was beyond terrible to me and my friends. The service was beyond bad, the food was wrong, and we ended up not even getting to eat.  I came here with my friends an hour and a half before a movie was supposed to start. We got in got a table fast and ordered Chicken and shrimp dish. I'd never tried it before (still haven't) after about 20 minutes which is still a long wait we get our food. It's fish and chips. We both ordered the same thing and we both got fish and chips. We tell our waiter and he just looks at us weird. 15 minutes later they take the food away and apologize. 25 minutes later no food. After that the manager says he will give us fries while we wait. 45 minutes later we are late for the movie and we still don't get our food. We say forget it and ask to leave then they try and charge us for the food!  Thankfully we didn't have to pay for our food. They weren't busy it was 6:15 on a Wednesday.  Do yourself a favor go to another one. This one needs new staff and a better manager.

We went last week on Tuesday, they where not staffed for the crowd. We waited to be seated, for awhile. Hostess gave us water, no waiter offered. After a 20 min wait sitting at table we had to leave. We where not the only ones that left. I spoke to manager he claims was aware of toddler Tues for May.

Great place to come and have a really nice burger, I really dig the fries in this place, they have sweet potatoes and regular fries. Also their lemonade its the best, either way you can not go wrong. Parking sometimes it's not best but also not the worse. Why the 4 stars? well service here works as parking, if you don't know what I'm talking about, read the review again!

I don't usually frequent Red Robin, but I work around the corner from the Tustin restaurant location and came on a whim one Wednesday afternoon. Brian the manager has absolutely changed my opinion of this establishment. I'm a stickler for good service (and always tip accordingly), and Brian epitomizes the restaurant service experience. He remembers regulars, not only names but specifics on meal and drink preparation. He is the lifeline of this Reb Robin, and I would be remiss to not give him the credit he deserves. Highly recommend coming here and asking for Brian when you do!

Came in on a Monday night and the place was practically empty. Two other tables were occupied in the dining room. It took 26 minutes to receive a salad and side of broccoli. When I asked the server, Paola, she just said there was only one cook and she had other tables waiting longer than me so I would just have to wait a little longer. I also asked a manager what the problem was, who didn't seem to care. They did notice me writing my Yelp review and both suddenly became apologetic, and offered me a free appetizer next time. It's unfortunate that it took that, it should have been their immediate response. Very disappointed in this location.

For what it is, Red Robin is expensive! Mediocre burgers shouldn't be more than $10/each but if people keep comin'... I also recognize that Red Robin is great for a couple things: groups, families with kids, people that want to drink, people that eat a lot, people that are picky eaters, people that enjoy being loud and boisterous during meals, watching the game, etc. The list could go on and I think you get what I'm trying to convey. I came in with my family. Portions are fairly large and with bottomless fries, you're the only one to blame if you leave hungry. Food was okay and service was par for the course. Perhaps the best feature here is the tableside check pay using a tablet. No more tracking down your service to run your card. No more of your card leaving your sight line. No more having to explain to the server how much money goes on each card or how to split the check. Do it yourself, at your table, get a receipt printed right there too and be on your way out.

In not a huge yelp reviewer but I have to say Brian the manager at red Robin in tustin district gives the best customer service I have probably ever had at a restaurant. He is timely professional and always gets our order right. I would highly recommend coming to this location if you are a red Robin fan- and even if your not i would suggest give it a try as you won't  find better service anywhere.

Definitely like this new location but parking can be difficult mainly because it's the district. Every time I come here it is pretty packed. Service is always great and quick whenever I come but it is the food that is lacking here. Nothing really comes out like it is pictured in the menu, except for the fries and onion rings. I feel like the food is either too dry or too drenched in sauce. Love the bottomless fries and season salt. I appreciate that they always have options for healthy conscious people. What I also like about this location is that they have the checkout iPads at eat table where you can settle your bill directly on the iPad whenever you are finished with your meal- so no waiting for the check! So convenient!

Just finished up dinner with a friend at Red Robin. Im starting a new nutrition regiment tomorrow so this was kind of a 'last supper' of sorts. I'm a HUGE fan of California Pizza Kitchens lemonade's which I mentioned to our AWESOME server Mason the Great! He was charismatic, had excellent recommendations and definitely knows his menu. I was pleasantly provided a fantastic lemonade surpassing he previously mentioned.  It's evident Mason the Great (Yes, it's necessary to use it again) enjoys his job. We will absolutely be back!!!  Thanks for another great experience at Red Robin. I'll remember the awesome bar when March Madness comes around!
Bad service and bad food expensive prices how are they still in business? You may as well eat out of the trash and burn your cash with a lighter, that would be the equivalent.

Came in only to redeem my free birthday burger on the day it was about to expire, I'm not a huge fan of burgers but the boyfriend is so I figured he'd enjoy this meal more. I ordered the chicken bruschetta burger and he got the whiskey river BBQ burger. I'm guessing mine was finished cooking first and just sitting in the kitchen until his was done because both my burger and fries were really cold... So sad. Finished half the burger and a few fries and lost my appetite.  The server was really attentive in bringing me refills on my strawberry lemonade though! I drank 3 LOL yum ^.^

My friends and I came here last Saturday and we called ahead so we didn't have to wait to long once we arrived. We all got burgers and a variety of drinks including the pear lemonade, raspberry limeade,  root beer floats, Guiness beer shake and an orange blood margarita.  We started with the onion ring tower. The onion rings were hot, crisp and tasty. When they brought the food out we didn't waste any time in ordering more fries and the new fries were brought out just in time as we were finishing what came with the burgers. I got the smoke and pepper bacon burger and it was cooked perfectly and was delicious. All my friends enjoyed their burgers too and nothing was left behind. Also, my friend signed up for their birthday club and got a free burger coupon. A nice bonus.  And the service was top notch. Our server was Bobby and he was on top of everything.

New management has destroyed this location.  This used to be my favorite restaurant to celebrate life's small victories.  But it is dead to me now.  1) The atmosphere is stripped away and it looks like a McDonalds.  2) The signature sauce burgers are dry, and well done comes out as rare-but-charred.  3) The milkshakes are disgusting chemical soft serve now.  4) Seventy five cents for the sauce to the free unlimited fries.  Nice trick, that one.

Red Robin is always a good casual place for a quick bite to eat when you want to sit and relax and want to do something different than fast food (by fast food I mean in-n out or chic fil-a, not McCrap or GarbageKing eww!!) I consider this place to be 2 levels above Denny's or IHOP and 1 or 2 levels below BJ's or Lazy dog). You can kind of eat healthyish here (not organic healthy, but calorie and fatness healthy) depending on what you order. But then again if you're coming here, you're getting the fries and burger. So you will leave here feeling guilty, hating yourself a little, and promising yourself a gym visit.  Ok food is served, time to start hating myself!

We just went there at around 8pm, Sat at the bar and ordered sandwiches and salad. The place was pretty busy. We waited and waited and finally after half an hour we asked the bartender where our order is. He said it should be almost ready and asked us to use the ipad device that was on the counter to pay first. There was no apology or attempt to make up for the delayed order. Finally we asked him to pack our order in to go boxes and we left after paying the check. We would not be back and would not recommend this place. We understand that sometimes orders are delayed and things take longer but the manner in which this matter was handled reflect poor training.

A great place to come for cheap food and big portions!!!! I say big portions of course because of the bottomless fries that come with every burger. :P Also the strawberry lemonade is bottomless as well and it's sooo good (probably because all of the sugar) My friends and I have come here a few times, the main reason being the fries are bottomless and those dipping sauces are amazing! My favorites have got to be the campfire sauce, the sweet & spicy ketchup, and the honey mustard/poppy seed sauce. Definitely remember to ask for sauces because they make the fries and the burger so much better!! The burgers here are okay, I wouldn't say anything too special. They are very large though! I can never finish a whole burger (probably because i'm stuffing my face with fries)! The meat here is okay, sometimes it can be dry. I love how they have a variety of burgers though; red robin has so many different toppings to choose from. Service here is okay, I wouldn't say it's superb or anything but the waiters and waitresses get the job done. They're not going to fill your fries or lemonade right away you usually have to ask. Will probably be back for the bottomless fries haha. Burgers are usually around ~$10-11 so it's definitely a good deal if you want big portions with a small price tag!!

The seats in the bar are the most comfortable bar stools I have ever sat on. If I was to base my review off these seats, Red Robin would get 5 plus stars. Seriously I could have sat there for hours. Anyway, the food is good. Not spectacular off the charts best thing you've ever had but it's consistently tasty every time so you know what you are going to get. The service is great, everyone is always very friendly and helpful. The only negative is that those fancy burgers they push look nothing like the photo. Not even close, I know how photoshoots work but at least you could make it kind of resemble the photo and use the same bacon. My husband ordered the southern charm and it looked completely different, I thought they brought out the wrong order. It just looked like some cheap basic burger with limp bacon but he said it tasted great and really in the end that's all that matters.

We visited this locations last weekend and found it to be mediocre compared to some of the other locations I have been to. Our major complaint is about the service. Even though the restaurant was not too busy, our server took her own sweet time getting our orders. We ordered drinks to start with. Server comes back to confirm if I wanted a 16oz or a 22oz beer and returns after a wait. A beer and a margarita should not take 15-20 minutes.  Same issue with the meal. Ordered a burger and a fish entrée which took another 15-20 minutes. The fish entrée was okay but the burger seemed to be pretty bland even though it was a peppercorn burger! Do not plan on frequenting this particular location specially when I do know that most of the other locations I've been to have way better service.

The royal burger baby. Order it and let that shit soak in your mouth.  Bottomless fries too. Oh yea I had no idea you could ask for the fries ahead of time!! Wahoo!!! My server was named Cameron. Nice fellow. Oh the freckled lemonade was definitely a thirst quencher for reals. Always find myself coming back here.  Get the royal burger!!! Bacon, eggs, cheese, fat patty. Yummy!! Great service too!!

My kids love coming to Red Robin and its a great place to bring the family. They have a good selection of gourmet burgers. Basically a little something for everyone.  I would have to agree that parking can be troublesome if you come at the wrong time, but we try to come early to beat the crowds.  We've been coming here for awhile and at times customer service dipped a bit, but lately we'v been pleasantly surprised by the staff as they have stepped things up. Wonderful wait staff the past three times we came.  I love the Avo-cabbo salad as it is a large portion, a great value and tastes great. My second favorite is the Bruschetta Chicken and the rest of my family love the bacon cheeseburgers.  We like the bottomless fries. They are the best. Nice and crispy.  Kids like the Cookie Magic shake too. We will be coming back again soon as long as the customer service continues to stay high. My only complaint (why not a five star) is that the cool little electronic kiosks where you pay for you meal always seems to have issues printing your receipt. Otherwise I like the idea behind the device. One last comment, being a member to Red Robin Royalty club pays off too. Love the perks and free food.

Such a great and warm welcoming from Scott.  He brought water for my Service dog without even asking!  He turned on the heather for us and i really felt im home! Now about sweet Sarah, she had tables full of people, one table and 30 people and she was still super friendly and welcoming !  Thanks for having such a great group here!  Thanks Sara and Thanks Scott

Weird experience. Ordered fish and chips. Half way through I started noticing the fish was turning pink. When I flipped the over I realized the red writing on the paper lining the basket which it was served in, was leaking off all over my fish dinner. So I told the server. She said she had never seen it before and stated she would let the kitchen manager know who was there that evening. After I paid the bill for the fish I didn't eat, I couldn't really understand why I wasn't at least offered a new fish entree or approached by a manager about this disgusting experience. So i asked for the kitchen manager to come by.  He did.  He said he had never seen that before. Never apologized or offered to correct the problem or experience. I hope the general manager sees this review. How embarrassing.  Update: I was contacted by a manager apologizing about my experience. Starting the convo with "we really dropped the ball didn't we. " That was all it took for me to forgive and forget. That was all I was asking for.  Thank u.

I thought I would give this place a try again after the remodel but it was big mistake on my part.  I came here yesterday during the KC/Green Bay game and it wasn't crowded at all.  There was no wait in line and our server was fairly attentive with the food cooked properly.  Just don't order the chips because they always tend to over cook them. The bartender was really nice and changed the channel to the football game.  I mean, what could be better, sitting at home watching the game or sitting in Red Robins watching the game and eating fries? So why the 1 star review from the previous 2 star review?  I guess the hostess really taught me a lesson on where my "kind" belong.  The real host was a younger kid in a red robin black polo shirt.  But there was this older lady (not dressed in any red robin attire) and it's obvious that she was the manager of the place and was the big helper in the host area. I asked for crayons to keep my 18 month daughter occupied until the food came and she told me that they longer give crayons nor do they have them in stock.  Instead, take this dirty chalkboard, eraser, and a small piece of chalk and have your daughter played with it. Well, the small piece of chalk is a choking hazard!  Do you understand that?  I figured they were trying to be eco-friendly or something so I put it back. Then this Caucasian couple came in after us 10 minutes later and they had 5 kids in their party.  Before the kids came in, they rolled out the red carpet for them and gave each kid seat some crayons and coloring sheet before the kids were seated.  Their initial order was also 7 glasses of waters so it wasn't a money thing. WTF?  Not sure what was going on but I will go elsewhere for my drinks (not water) and dinner due to this poor judgement on their part.  Thanks for not seating me next to the door, bathrooms, or kitchen on this visit so you get 1 star for that. As I was leaving, I saw in the host area, plenty of crayons and coloring sheets.  Fed Ex must have delivered at 730pm just after I was seated because racism is unheard of these days and you cannot accuse a racist of being racist because it's not PC.  Let's make excuses for them; Monday was a soft re-opening, staff not properly trained, unaware of items in host area, etc. NEVER AGAIN, WILL I VISIT ANOTHER RED ROBIN!

Waiting so long to be seated, once we were seated took another 30 minutes just to get food.... the food was mediocre at best. Oreo shake was good. would not come again. offer bottomless fries but the waiter never came to us so we were unable to even get them.

For the price, I think I could actually get a much better burger somewhere else but Red Robin's does offer convenience since most of their locations are at malls. The food is actually pretty good but definitely not gourmet or something I would rave about to friends. They have a lot of options so you don't have to get a burger. Most meals are at least ten dollars. You can definitely get your moneys worth with baskets of their bottomless fries. The boyfriend and I usually share an entree and get stuffed with more fries. Not the healthiest option LOL but definitely cost effective. The red robin seasoning makes the bottomless fries deelish! We tend to stick to the chicken sandwiches or wraps to be a little healthier and I personally think they are better than the burgers. We like the whiskey river bbg chicken sandwich/wrap or the bruschetta chicken sandwich. There are also great vegetarian options for the non-meat eaters! Their late night happy hour starts at 8pm which is earlier than most places, so the boyfriend and I like to come here when we missed the earlier happy hour but don't want to wait til late night. We're old now and need our rest. :( However, their happy hour offerings are much more limited than most other restaurants. Only a few drinks are discounted. Thankfully, I don't mind sticking to their margaritas which are included in happy hour. You can only get happy hour at the bar or in the patio. If you're craving a sweet ending to your meal, they offer a blue moon shake that's bomb!

I went here again only because friends asked me to.  Yet again...it sucked.   Amber, our waitress needs to slow down, breathe, maybe smile for her clients, offer more drinks and dessert, check on the table to see if the food is ok, and perhaps use proper English.  bottomless fries....sure, because they taste like crap.
Unfortunately we arrived there to find out they would no longer allow dogs on the patio.  Boo

Not super pleased with how one of the managers treats her employees. Seems that she treats them with a lack of respect. It does not seem like a fun place to work. Again not too please with this managers attitude towards her fellow workers and staff members.

Our server Bobby was awesome! Even on a busy Friday night in the bar he was very attentive and never let our drinks go empty. Definitely ask for him! Red Robin is great because you get so much food for the price and they're always willing to customize. You can't beat bottomless fries! The food always comes out fast and I love their veggie burgers since I'm vegetarian but my friends are all carnivores, so it's great having options for everyone.

Our server was friendly and the strawberry milkshake was delicious, but the food was swimming in grease. I asked for none of the citrus oil that came on my burger yet it was literally dripping with grease, I'll add a picture. I couldn't eat the bun at all and had to use my napkin on the rest.

Went to Redrobin tonight. Was very diappointed. When we were seated the host was really nice and got us our drink order immediately.  However, the waiter didn't come to our table to take our order for quite awhile and he apologized for the mix up because he thought someone else was going to wait out table. I appreciated that but as we were waiting for our food we scanned our royalty card then paid our bill. Then I started to answer a question air the first answer was about the service so I was going to give them an 8 (pretty good, right?) Well my boyfriend took it and said since our food isn't here yet we better give all high marks so he changed my answer,  well I went home and got food poisoning he didn't. Hm....makes me wonder if someone is watching your answers from the get go. My salad was not very good at all. It wasn't fresh and the chicken wasn't cooked. I won't go back!

Will was our server and he is AMAZING!! He exceeded our expectations. Constantly checked up on us through the entire. No matter what we asked for, he was always there with a smile. He had great customer service skills and deserves recognition. Red Robin needs to hire more people like Will.

Stopped in with the family today for lunch and we were seated in a huge booth right under some exposed fiberglass insulation...EWE! I guess they are doing some ceiling remodeling/construction but to be seated underneath insulations is pretty gross. My dad noticed because before we even sat down he started itching and have having minor asthma issues. I know this may sound extreme because I'm sure many people aren't even aware of or allergic to fiberglass insulation, but I still think it's unsanitary for a restaurant to function this way.  Anyways, we left before ordering and decided to eat at Sharkey's instead which made for a better lunch in the end.
Always quick and friendly service, even when the place is packed. Never left disappointed!

We haven't been to a Red Robin in awhile so we decided to stop by for dinner. It was very busy & we were told we would have about a 20 min. wait. It turned out we only had to wait about 10 minutes. Our server was excellent. She was very attentive and helpful. I told her that I usually order the same thing, the guacamole burger & she helped with my decision to order something else. I ordered the Whiskey River BBQ burger. I was very happy with my choice & she came back after we started eating to make sure that I was satisfied with my selection. She made sure our drinks & fries were refilled. We asked to have our burgers cooked medium & that is how they were prepared. We were very happy with our experience at this Red Robin & will go back & ask for the same server next time!

So, I wasn't sure if I should give it a 2 or 3 stars.... but just please hear me out.  First of all, I think that every restaurant should provide the highest, freshest quality in ALL of their foods prepared. There is no reason that one menu item should be "better" than another one. Every menu item should be cooked and handled with 100% care and attention to achieve customer satisfaction.  With that said, the Hummus & Vegetable Appetizer should have been "up to par", just as their "gourmet burgers."  Why should this dish have LESS FRESH ingredients, or "LESS QUALITY" vegetables?  The "grilled zucchini" that you see in my photo, looks like it came fresh off the grill.. NOT!!! These zucchinis were COLD!!! It's as if they grilled it HOURS before and just left it sitting out in the cold... You know, you could at least reheat it!! (even if it's not fresh... just to make it better for the customer to eat...)  The "baby carrots" were NOT WASHED!!!!  The jicama was good.  The hummus, not bad.. I actually liked the bits of garlic on top..  Some of you who are reading this review, might be thinking, "why does your rating reflect a 'non-burger' item?"   Well, like I explained earlier, just because the restaurant doesn't specialize in a certain menu item, doesn't give them the permission to serve "poorer quality" food???  If they can't go a good job preparing the meal, then DON'T PUT IT ON THE MENU!  Don't say that you can provide _____ dish, when it's not 100% good quality, and made with good effort!  You can't even wash and heat up the food???

Red Robin is your typical chain restaurant, nothing extraordinary, but decent food. Being that it is walking distance from my house, I sometimes stop by to eat when I am too lazy to cook haha. Prices are great and service is always good.

Overall a good casual dinner out. Food was good and service was good as well. The buser did a nice job helping out our main server. Both were attentive.  The onion rings are so good and the dipping sauce is addicting. I had the Whiskey River burger which is an excellent standard. I get my fries extra crispy which they will always do no problem.  We really like the Ziosk on the table. You can order drinks, request your server and most of all to pay when you are ready to leave is AMAZING! That will make me come back.  The other thing to check out is the reward club. You can earn free food and you get a free burger for your birthday which is really nice.

Great service and a great salad today. I sat at the bar. Paola & Brandon were my servers, and they did an excellent job. I had the grilled chicken with ranch dressing. An excellent choice. And it's well priced! Definitely will have it again.

The food was great...once we got it. Ordered a couple appetizers and entrees about 5 minutes after we sat down. 20 minutes later, we got our appetizers. 25 minutes after that we got our entrees. The entrees took so long that I didn't even want it when they finally came. Not to mention the waitress was basically non-existent when she wasn't either bring us our food or cashing us out. Won't be coming back unless I have an hour and a half to kill.

Used to love coming here until a couple of bad experiences before the remodel. Then after almost a year of boycott I was craving their French Onion Soup. So I returned.  I was very impressed at the remodeling and the new atmosphere. Food tasted better than before. Managers and servers are friendly too. Whatever changes that were made ... it's going to keep me coming back for more.

Worse Service - I normally give servers benefits of the doubt and be every understanding because their Job is hard.  However today - we actually encountered a practically NO SERVICE experience.  When you wait for server to come back so you can get fries - for 15 min.. and never refilled any drinks... and no other servers were not helping - its definitly an issue with floor manager.  Unfortunately we will never return to this location again.

Slow services even when it's not busy and my tortilla soup was Luke warm when was brought to the table. My coworker's fries were cold and her burger did not have any flavor. Plus it took 20 to get our bill.

We had a late lunch here last weekend, and enjoyed our meals.  The restaurant is undergoing some refurbishment, so there are no decorations on the walls other than holes and anchors.  There was no sign regarding this, and I think they probably should have some sort of notice before customers enter the restaurant.   Other than that, this is a pretty standard Red Robin, which we enjoy.  Cheyenne was our server, and she was great.

Food quality across the board at Red Robin is going down hill???   This was the second trip let down after the first one off of bristol and sunflower. for an app we got whiskey bbq wings over a bed of yukon gold chips, chips were over fried and slightly burnt and now soggy under the bbq sauce.  Wings were decent enough the whiskey bbq sauce tastes very store bought not as good as it used to be. The fries are pretty stale, dry and just plain bleh. I ordered the bacon burger, which was ok, but reminiscent of getting a burger at mcdees or other fast food joint, not worth the price my bf got the crispy chicken tender, which was a battered and fried chicken breast.  Boy was that an interesting sandwich the batter just falls off and gives you a totally dripped and soaked in oil fried taste.... maybe red robin should just go fast casual and lower the price, since they're already lowering the bar on quality?

I usually love red robin chili but this Tustin location has awful chili!! Spoons of oil, 2 tiny pieces of onion and cheese, and barely mashed up burger meat. Don't order it!   There was a 20 min wait at 515pm despite open booths and tables that would have fit our party of 4.  Only positives were our waitress (Megan?) was nice and they had some free balloons In the lobby for kids...

Pros and Cons Pros  Pros  1. Tasty food  2. Nice decor  Cons  1. Small Portions  2/ Slow Service  i came here recently and ordered the Garden Burger. It was quite tasty and the fries were delicious and endless. However, the portion of the hamburger was rather tiny and the service was quite slow. However, the good food made up for the small portions. I also like the paintings  and photos they have on the wall contributing to the overall good experience dining at Red Robin.

The host was sweet and our server is named Hollie. She came to get our drink order, i ordered right away. A wedge salad, BBQ whiskey burger and first to start because we were hungry. She asked if i wanted the salad right away and i said yes. We waited 10 minutes before we got  the salad and the fries. we didn't get any utensils/napkins. I had to ask the manager for it. Hollie wasn't that attentive. It wasn't a good experience for me, it was my birthday but they didn't sing to me nor ask for dessert- she knew it was my bday.
It was Thursday date night and we were craving burgers! Great burgers and great service!

After a stressful day, decided to come here for lunch. Was greeted by my server, Cheyenne, with a big smile. Ate my delicious lunch, with ever-so-attentive Bobby, checking on my needs. Cheyenne went behind the bar, still beaming that never-ending smile. Great food, at reasonable price point, even better service !!

I went here on my birthday because I heard they hook you up with a free burger for your birthday. Awesome right? WRONG! I went to lunch with a girl and after we ate I excitedly told our waitress it was my birthday, showed my ID and she stared at me like I was stupid. How embarrassing. After she made me sheepishly awkwardly explain that the company she works for gives free burgers on your birthday (and gets about $15+tip from each person that goes with you) she tells me I had to sign up for an advertising program. She knew what I was talking about. I called ahead and they didn't mention this at all. AND ON TOP OF THAT even if I did it right there on the spot it wouldn't work right then "but I can come again till the end of the month". No thanks.  Oh and when I asked for a second serving of "Bottomless Fries" to go, she had to ask her manager. So I guess they wanted me to just *trick* them like a regular jerk and pretend to ask for more fries, then ask for a box to go; wasting everyone's time.  I just moved into one of the apartments nearby and was excited about this Red Robin nearby but forget it.  Later on I went to STARBUCKS for my birthday and the staff was all hyped for me, gave me a free coffee, and wrote HAPPY B-DAY!!! on my cup. Awesome.  Red Robin sucks. I should have stayed home and microwaved a burrito. (ps, Don't waste your money upgrading to the garlic herb fries. You get about 20-something shavings of parmesan cheese and about 3 shakes of clumpy seasoning in the direct center of the fries. Lame.)

My visit to Red Robins at the District was simply average. That's not a bad thing however, I would say that compared to my other Red Robin experiences this was probably my least satisfying visit.  One thing I would like to highlight from my visit was my server. She was extremely friendly, very professional and she pretty much garnered the extra star, otherwise I would have rated this Red Robin 2 stars.  My biggest complaint about this particular Red Robin is that the food was really sub-par. I ordered the chili chili burger, which was described to be an extremely messy but delicious burger. However, what I got instead was a small cheeseburger with literally a spoonful of chili  on my burger patty. Simply put, it was extremely disappointing to pay up to $10 for a "gourmet" burger that tasted like a regular cheeseburger with chili that tasted like it was from a can.  However, that's not all. My girlfriend ordered the prime house burger with a boca patty substitution. Although I thought her burger was pretty good she complained that parts of her burger was dry. Also we ordered chips with salsa and guacamole, but what we got instead was a handful of chips and a spoonful of guacamole and salsa.   The common problem here at this Red Robin is simple, the food is overly priced for such little portions. I can't say that I would visit this Red Robin again since there are so many other burger chains nearby such as Islands, In n Out, and 5 guys that offer better burgers for better prices. To average eatings.
Awesome location!! Our order was messed up and one of the managers, Elias, helped us and even took the mistake off our bill. Thank you for your awesome customer service!! Will definitely be back.

I havent always been a big fan of Red Robin... It seems like the food always came out cold and it was pretty bland. This is a nice location - although going here during the week during lunch hour can be hazardous to your health, holy parking lot insanity!!!  I suggest parking over by the movie theater and walking... although now that area will be swarming with all of you who read this.  Hmmmm, ha ha. Anyway... We went for lunch with a party of 9.  The wait at 12:30-ish was only about 5 minutes... and our waiter was awesome.  He got all of our orders right, and everything we needed came out fast!  I ordered the Tavern burger, Pig style or whatever it was called (with bacon) and I really liked the burger! I like their fries as well, but I have noticed if I put more of the seasoning on them, it tastes like cleaner.  No, I dont like cleaners usually, but you know, when you associate tastes with the way something smells.   ANYWAY, I was happy with my visit to this Red Robin, minus the mass hysteria of the parking lot... but its always been like that, so its not due to just Red Robin.

If I could give 10 stars, I would. I am a Red Robin lover, I have loved Red Robin for YEARS. I've gone to Red Robins all over the west coast for many years, and this Red Robin by far has been the best I've ever been to. My experience was nothing but fabulous. I went on my lunch break from work, and the bartender greeted me right away, took my order, made a few jokes, and was very personable. It made me feel more than just a customer. My food came out so quick that I was shocked. The manager(s) (I think there were 2?) kept checking on  me, also throwing some humor in. It was a fun experience, especially since I was eating alone. The food was super delicious, and I know what it's going to taste like every time, however this time, it seemed to taste extra good. Thank you to the staff at Red Robin for a wonderful dining experience! I will for sure be back :)

Had a great experience here with my friends tonight. The manager Elias was absolutely wonderful, we had a mistake in our order and he fixed it quickly. our food came out quickly and I loved that we could pay the check at the table. Will definitely be recommending this Red Robin to all of my friends and family.

We went there yesterday for our 3 rd marriage anniversary ... The staffs were really polite and made us comfortable.. The guest service was awesome.. An middle aged woman was our waitress.i forgot to ask her name.... She was really good with describing the dishes as it was our first time to be here..we ordered for onion ring and burgers .. The only issue was the onion ring.. It was too greasy that I couldn't eat my burger after having eaten two of them.. Rest was great .. Once again.. Guest service was adorable
After consuming my first/last Tavern Burger, I can say without a doubt that what I consumed today made me a firm believer that eating out should be a quality event and not one of value.
Elias is an amazing manager! When things went wrong, he hopped right on it to make sure we were happy and having a great experience. Wonderful customer service. I highly recommend this Red Robin :)

My husband and I live very close to this location and have come to it a few times. The service has been pretty spotty but last night we went in and our server Brandi really turned it around for us.  We always head straight to the bar seating and usually get the same table every time, which is nice!  Brandi took our drink order and brought us some waters as well. She was very friendly and helpful with getting or order in quickly. Our drinks were out in no time and they were great! Our food shortly followed and I looked at my husband and said "this is seriously the best service we've had at this Red Robin", and honestly it might be the best service we've ever had at any Red Robin. Like most restaurants, we can't always have the best service at all times, especially depending on how busy the location is or how new the server is or maybe sometimes people don't take their job as seriously as they should but Brandi really went above and beyond, the manager working even came up and asked how everything was going and we told him the same thing, he was very appreciative and it was nice to even be asked how things were going, you don't see that happen at all restaurants.

Yes, it's a burger chain, so do not expect to be in Mastro's.  However, for a chain this Red Robin serves delicious food for the price and the customer service is actually surprisingly very good.  Servers are very attentive and have a genuinely good attitude.  My wife and I go here to eat about three times a month.

A solid 3 star.  I wish I could give more, but Red Robin burgers don't entirely do it for me. THE MOOD: Fun, friendly, and casual.  This Red Robins is located right in The District.  It's in a spacious location and easy to find. THE 'TUDE: The service here is what makes this place awesome!  We were promptly greeted with smily faces when we walked in.  As we had a party of 10+ people for this birthday meal, they made sure to keep us updated on the status of our table.  We only had to wait about 15 minutes tops on a Friday evening (awesome) before we got seated. Our waiter immediately greeted the portion of our party that had already arrived and offered fries for the table while we waited for the others to join us.  We were celebrating 4 birthdays that evening and our waiter couldn't have been any nicer.  Waters were consistently being refilled, our orders were brought our promptly, and he tended to our table's every little request.  Thanks for making our meal so enjoyable! THE FOOD: The food is okay.  My bf is in love with Red Robin burgers.  For me, the bread on the burgers always come out super soggy and the flavors just fall flat for me, but if the rest of my group and my bf are happy, then I am happy! OVERALL: I will probably find my way back here.  I like the location and the fact that there are great little shops that I can browse after my meal!

Its been a long time since I was a friend of Red Robin.  After a huge falling out of bad service, burgers, menu items from the past, I haven't been back in a few years. But now, this time I have felt RR's redemption in becoming better than it was before, and I have returned to make amends. I wasn't disappointed. The Tustin District location is fairly new, and has a great atmosphere. Very clean, and staff is accommodating. Although, we had waited for our food due to a computer delay in ordering, both the server and manager gave me their most sincere apologies and discounted the order. Ok, kudos for sure. Perks: New vivacious menu to explore. New Bar Drinks and Libations are extremely inviting. Their Mango Margarita is smooth and very chill. Mini appetizer versions are adorable. The Mini Onion Ring Tower is a Must starter. Awesome TIP: The Royal Red Robin Burger is uber super delish!! A must try if you are a supremo burger lover. A++ for Tasty ooooh la la Overall: I have forgiven and its a BFF relationship all over again. Have a burger-iffic Time!

I've always loved RR's "Burning Love" burger, but as I was looking at the menu, my eyes were glued onto what was called the "Ghost Burger" (or so Red Robin calls it).  So I thought, "Ohhh hell yeah, I'll try it!" :D My bartender/waitress of the day, Jayme, was kind enough to answer my question of, "What's the "Ghost Style" that adds on an extra $1.00 to the burger?  She told me that instead of the chipotle mayo that was in the "Burnin' Love," it has more of a "kick" to it made from hot peppers that was actually NOT from "ghost peppers" themselves.  So, I took a bite of my burger, smiled, and asked her jokingly, "Where's the fire?" (Hehe). :D  I didn't feel any tingling on my tongue.  She laughed and told me that there was no actual peppers in the burger, so then I thought, "Damn it..."  Oh well, the burger was good, service was excellent...what's to complain about? :D

Muchhhh better than the location at the Irvine Spectrum. The food is great. Onion rings are delicious as always, burgers are juicy and full of flavor, and their fries are always crisp and yummy! The only dish I didn't like was the happy-hour buffalo wings. 4 small wings and chips for $5 is not a very good deal.  Our server was super quick with service and was always coming back to get us more drinks, sauces, etc.  The blended margaritas here are bombbbb! I tried the Blue Moon milk shake for the first time and it was delicious! Tasted just like a orange-creamsicle!

Sorry Red Robin but this was the final straw that broke the camels back. I came back with my son and this experience was even worse! Don't get me wrong I came two other times and the service and the food was good. Even this time the food was decent. We came sat down, waited awhile for our waitress. She finally game around and told us that she would be right back.  Little did I know that right back was going to be awhile.  I finally flagged down someone and then she came.  After that still a wait for our beverages.  Burgers were good, fries were a little cold but nothing to really complain about. This maybe a last for us. Bye bye banzai burger. Need to eat healthier anyways lol
Not the best burger...average but service was with a smile. Tables were a little wobbly and the manager came over and asked about our experience. Nice touch and nice to see they care.

Really enjoyed our dinner. Our server was Jeff he was pleasant, our party really appreciated his service smile and great attitude. Kept checking up on our table it was a busy night. Food came out in a timely matter.

If you're looking for a fairly cheap burger and fries, around $10, then Red Robin is the place for you.  The environment is suitable for everyone; families, teens, adults, they accommodate for everyone.  You can get coloring pages for the kids, or come for happy hour, which is 3-pm everyday.  I believe the beers are $2.50 during happy hour, and the appetizers are also discounted, but you have to sit in the bar area for the happy hour prices.
