Some of my favorites here are the patty melt, the banzai burger, or whiskey bbq burger.  They also have great grilled chicken if you're not in the mood for red meat.  The great thing about all the burgers is that in comes with bottomless fries.  When I say bottomless, I mean bottomless.  I've had 7 basket of fries at my table at one time.  You just have to keep asking, but the servers will oblige.  They also have a great freckled strawberry lemonade that I'd recommend.   All in all I enjoy Red Robin, always makes for a good meal for little money.
Red Robins is pretty mediocre. The only good thing about the place is the bottom-less fries. Other than that, you can get way better burgers elsewhere. The service is always good, though.

The three stars are for the service. We did open seating at the bar and the bartender/server did not pay attention to us at all. Waited about 5 minutes to order when we were one of two parties at the bar. The burgers are what you will get at any red robin. Once we were done we waited about ten minutes of no service until we decided to just do the mobile pay check.

Stopped by here after trying to just get a bite to eat, got say right away which was a plus. Our hostess was nice and vibrant.  Out server also following his footsteps. The restaurant is super clean and fast. I digg the employees attitude, it just makes for a better experience. The food was on point as always. Were regulars at red robin so it's nice having the same quality. The location is prime and has it's own parking lot.

Bottomless fries... yeah right, ordered some extra fries and they pretend to not have any ready until they notice that you have finished your sandwich/burger then go by your table and say "do you still want those fries"... Ruby's Diner is much better.

Shame on RR !!! Do not use the little iPad on the table you will be charged $2 for its services !! We were not told this by our wait staff or the hostess, but they both encouraged us to use it.  This is SNEAKY & SHIFTY bad business practrice Ripoff Robin !!!!!

My husband and I usually grab a burger before watching a movie. This location is convenient and usually doesn't have more than a 30 min wait. The waitress usually doesn't have much of a personality, they take your order and walk away until your food comes or about 15-20 min intervals. Very robotic and you know they just want the night to be over. I've experienced this several times at this location.  Last week we ordered boneless wings as an appetizer and it didn't come out until towards the end of our meal. The waitress looked very irritated that the kitchen messed up and we insisted it was OK. Here is why we didn't mind the mix up, the manager Melissa came out right when she found out about the mistake and apologize for it in a very courteous way (great customer service!) our food came out eventually and we weren't in a rush. So in the end it wasn't a big deal because Melissa made it right with a simple gesture and smile.

I like Red Robin because they have BOTTOMLESS FRIES! I personally love thick, steak-cut fries and their seasoning is the best condiment to these golden stick of potatoes (dipping them in a side of ranch is so much better)! They're most known for their burgers, which are substantial, but I really just come here for the fries. If you're a burger person...this place is for you! Cash/Card and this location gets crowded on weekends around dinner time!

I have to say I'm a Red Robin fan and the Marketplace location so great!!  This location leaves much to be desired.  And it's not a one time bad service luck either.  This is my 3/4th time here and it's not any better.   It the our waitress over 10min to even acknowledge us.  No hi, how are you or anything.  I also had a free birthday burger, which is usually my family's favorite place to celebrate birthday, notta again.  I got my free burger since it was on my card.  My sweet potatoe fries were cold and so were my friend's garlic fries.  Boo.  And they offered no ice cream sundae or anything or even wished me a happy birthday.  Really?  Come on.  Our waitress was not friendly at all.  We are hoping she was just having a bad day.  Sadly to see, after so many errors here, I'll be going to other locations.  Don't expect much either if it's your birthday.

I have been here before with coworkers and had a pretty good experience. I gathered my family from the four corners of SoCal to come here for my mom's birthday. We drove hella far (from the other side if the IE and LA) to go here. We asked the birthday girl where she wanted to go. After going through a very long list, we decided on this Red Robin because of the location and the patio.  I called in Friday evening to give tgem the head's up that we were bringing in a big group and we wanted to sit on the patio. The girl took our info and she said I should call back Saturday about 3. I called at 3:45 and the girl I spoke with confirmed my info and said we were good. So we get here well before 6 and tell the girl our name and party size. The girl is confused. I asked her a few times if we were going to be able to sit on the patio. There was another group there, and I wanted to make sure that they knew that we had called twice and expected to be on the patio. The girl let me know that they were just waiting for people to leave. Next thing I know, they are seating the other party and taking us to a table inside. So I ask our waiter

They don't cook their burgers medium rare, what in the actual f... I'm regressing, let me start over. When I come for lunch the service is amazing. It took 5 seconds to get seated, my waiter brought me a refill when my cup was still half full and I hadn't even asked (admittedly mostly ice but still). Waiter checked up on us at least twice during the whole shebang, but for the most part let us do our thang.  I tried the Burning Love, in honor of singles appreciation day, it was surprisingly good although not as spicy as they make it sound.  They have this container of this cajun style spice, called the red robin powder or something like that. Well basically how it works is you put that on everything. And you don't sprinkle either, just take the top off it'll be easier trust me

Food was decent. Service was bad. Waited at the table for ten minutes without hearing from anyone - not even offered a drink. After 15 minutes, had to wave down a bus boy and say, "We're ready to order." Server still did not come. I noticed her waiting on a nearby table that was seated way after we were. Was it race? (Not assuming, just wondering - they were white and we are not). Or was it the size of the party? (We had 2, they had 5. Maybe she was counting on them giving her a bigger tip). Once service began, I ordered a side of mayo and campfire sauce. Server says, "Well ... it's the same thing. Campfire sauce is just mayo mixed with barbecue sauce." Uhmmm ... if I had wanted a list of ingredients, I would have asked. Is there a reason you're telling me this? So finally, food comes. It was fine. Realized I will not be coming back when I tried to wipe my fingers (oily from onion rings) and found we had been given no napkins. Later tried to spread mayo on my burger and saw we had never received any knives or forks either. That's okay, I'll just ask when they check on us. No one did. Had to use my fries to spread the mayo on the bun. In the future, I will just do Farmer Boys instead (which is not a sit-down restaurant). I go to Red Robin to be served a meal. If the service sucks, what's the point of paying $30.00 for burgers I can make at home?

Decent burgers, great french fries(since it's "unlimited"). They can be very busy, which means the waiters don't come around so often.  But I must share, last time I was here, I left my retainers and it was thrown in the trash. I came back, and they were able to retrieve it for me.  Thanks guys!

So while walking around the District, my son wanted Red Robin (basically just wanted mac n cheese). We waited about 5 minutes to be seated...which is not bad at all. Then the hostess brings us to this 2 person table (mind you its me, my wife, and 3 yr. old son)The table was  barely enough space for 2, let alone, 3! AND THERE WAS A BIG FAMILY RIGHT NEXT TO IT!! (basically it was a shared bench along the wall with these dinky tables)... So my wife asks if we could sit in one of the 2 booths that were open in the same area which were a better fit and more logical instead of cramming us in a tiny spot next to this huge family. So now we are in the booth and waiting for a server to come by...waiting....waiting....waiting....and finally he comes to finally offer us drinks, but about the time he got to us, we already looked over the menu several times and knew what we wanted. So then we put in our order, (kids mac n cheese w/oranges, Caesar salad, clam chowder soup,a short bbq boneless wings, 2 freckled lemonades, and a kids apple juice) and it took them nearly 40 mins to bring us our order out! I mean, come on! Mac n cheese which was like watered down cheese, Caesar salad...which was basically 2 sticks of lettuce, and you got to be kidding me about the clam chowder! Literally 5 scoops with a spoon and it was finished! They placed the soup in this small THICK bowl but for the price...It may be a little on the high side! And now the boneless bbq wings...which came out WITH BONE! So to tell me after the 36 minute wait....I have to wait some more?! So 6 min later they bring out my boneless wings which was extra extra battered and fried (made it really crunchy and unappetizing), and not even a (sorry for getting your order wrong, or a let me add some extra fries for free)or(would you like a free dessert for the long wait that should have only been a Five minute wait, 10 minutes to be extra generous) but no, just a "sorry for that"...So a recap, I am upset about the Price to ratio of food you are paying for, I am upset of the lack of customer service that my family and I received and also what I noticed of other servers serving other customers, and with that being said....I still like the royal burger! lol  My advice to the servers there...(not all)....it's not just the table you are assigned to that watches you. So keep that happy attitude always, specially when working in a customer service atmosphere. And if the wait is long, as long as you make the guest feel welcomed, other than just another table to wait on. Make the guest at easy by reassuring them that food will be coming out or just the check ups will make them feel like they are not forgotten.

I came back to try them again despite the multiple service issues and again they proved its just not worth it. The waiter didn't know the menu then they brought my food and it had a hair right on top of my wrap. I sent it back then had to ask for a manager to get one to come over. The manager apologized then said he would take care of our lunch which apparently meant only my food not the drinks or my friends food. Exactly how is that taking care of my lunch? Then when I asked the waiter to go check he came back and said that was correct. It wasn't until I asked for a survey the manager came back and offered to take care of it all. Once again bad service, need a new lunch spot.

This location of Red Robin is pretty consistent with their food quality. I think I've gone to this location like 100 times and I've never been severely disappointed with the food or service. Here and there, there's the occasional worker who needs another lesson on customer service, but, typically, I am happy with the enthusiasm my waiter displays. The burgers here are delicious, partly due to their complete customization capability. AYCE fries are a definite plus too. Come here hungry, leave bloated.
Went here yesterday around 4 o'clock and they were slammed for such an odd time. Food still came out quickly and drinks stayed filled. Good job Red Robin

This Red Robin location is unacceptable. I have been to this new location at least 7 times, and every time I end up with the burger not being cooked as I requested. The fries are always cold or microwaved and the service at the bar is non existent. As soon as you sit down at the bar and order food, your immediately brought the check as if to say hurry up and leave, yet the food takes 40 minutes with only a handful of customers in the bar. I understand out of 10 visits to a specific location your going to at least have 1 or 2 bad experiences. However this Red Robin location are a habitual repeat offender. If you are in the mood for Red Robin take the extra time and go to another location.

Used to be regulars and the service is just too slow for hungry kids. Over 45 minutes to get food on a minimally crowded Friday night just doesn't work anymore.... Not to mention, The District parking is the pits
This is my first time eating at Red Robin in Tustin, and the vibe is pretty awesome here. My server, Amber, was very attentive. Thank you Amber for making this such a pleasant experience!

I've tried many Red Robin's before and they are all just ok. This one however is probably the worst. Everything here is under salted, under seasoned, just bland.  Gave this location a 3rd chance as I come to this center frequently... It does not make the grade.  For the price of their food you definitely don't get your money's worth either. I'd do any other place. In n out still has it won 100%!!!

This Red Robin location officially opens on 7/9. The restaurant occupies what used to be the Marmalade Cafe. I visited this Red Robin location during their soft opening. After a friendly conversation with a manager, this Red Robin replaces the Tustin Marketplace location. Some complications with the lease between the old location and the Irvine Company arose, so Red Robin moved into The District, which is not under the control of the Irvine Company. The employees transferred with the move. The food of Red Robin is always consistent, service is always great, and my experiences always pleasant. If some sort of problem does occur, the staff tends to be excellent problem solvers. Red Robin also offers a happy hour from 3p - 8p, Monday through Friday.

I never really liked Red Robin. I think the burgers are overpriced and the meat tastes microwaved. Yeah, they have bottomless fries but their fries are soggy and gross. The RR seasoning is also pretty overrated. Came here during our lunch break at work. I got the Tavern double, cry baby style. I had never seen this before at a Red Robin, and not sure if this is exclusive only to this location since I hear it's a franchise. Cry baby style means that it comes with crispy onions, some onions grilled in sriracha, and some spicy ketchup. I was pretty impressed by this burger! The patties were actually decent and tasted like they made them, rather than rip open a bag of frozen ones. The title is misleading though, it is incredibly mild. But I still enjoyed it. I prefer flavor over burn. Our server was pretty awesome too. This was one of the few times I've gone to a restaurant and they didn't have to ask who ordered what. She also didn't take forever for our extra fries, water, sauce, or whatever we needed.

this place is so nostalgic for me, it brings me back to my undergraduate days. as broke college students, we'd stumble in and get our share of bottomless fries and freckled lemonade.  i didn't particularly feel like a burger at the time, so i ordered the chicken tenders + fried shrimp basket. chicken tenders were huge pieces of fried chicken, pretty standard. nothing amazing, nothing terrible. however, the fried shrimp was just...no. they seemed to be haphazardly fried and not well battered; the batter was falling off as i picked up a shrimp or took a small bite into it. i ate my batter and shrimp in two separate bites, haha. the bottomless fries sprinkled with the red robin seasoning was just as i remembered --- large, warm, wedges of potato, slightly crispy and fluffy.  not sure about the burgers, but everyone seemed to enjoy theirs just fine. order all the (free) sauces, they're all pretty tasty but please be sure....PLEASE be sure to order the honey mustard poppy seed sauce. THIS STUFF IS SO ADDICTIVE AND DELICIOUS. dare i say it's the best damn honey mustard i've ever had? hmm... it's sweet and has less of a distinct mustard taste.....so good, i drenched every fry and chicken tender in it.  also, like another reviewer mentioned, the service here is just fine, but it is a bit slow. we ordered 4 meals and they only gave us 1 small communal basket of bottomless fries, which i found to be odd. we had like 5 fries each and then we'd need a refill. however, since it was so slow, we were constantly waiting on refills. we were missing utensils and had to flag someone down for that. we needed sauces, had to get up and go looking for someone because nobody was coming by. took awhile to get our bill. for a saturday night, you'd think they'd be better staffed -- the place wasn't even busy. would probably come back just for the red robin seasoning on bottomless fries and honey mustard sauce, but wouldn't recommend coming hungry.

My roommates and I went to this location today for the first time. It was a poor experience. The service was poor. We had to ask another employee for utensils, napkins, and refills. I ordered the bacon guacamole burger, it was pretty good. My only complaint would be that there was barely any guacamole. The fries were undercooked, the texture was hard but not crispy. The television also was not working properly so could not watch the football game. Every time we asked for something simple it seemed as if we just asked our waitress a demanding task. Overall it was not a pleasant experience and would not return to this location.

I've never had a server completely neglect my table until now. My boyfriend and I came for dinner here to watch the nba finals. We ordered food and drinks but our server didn't care to check up on us. When she did come by she gave us the check. It was still the 2nd quarter of the game at this point and we planned to stay the entire duration of the game (like most of the crowd). We felt neglected and rushed. It doesn't make any sense to me why you would rush paying customers that wanted to order more food and drinks.

It's been so long since I had red robin burger, it felt nostalgic to have dinner there! Service was awesome, and the burger did not disappoint. I got the whiskey river BBQ burger with easy sauce, easy mayo, and it was perfect. Still full of flavor but not overwhelming. Will make an effort to come back more often.
Maybe it was just this day and this location, but they had the worst fries I've had and I usually love Red Robin's fries. I ordered them well done as always and they were just cold and ick. :(

I was told the Red Robin at this location was opening on 7/9 so I took a little bit of time to come visit. But other yelpers beat me to the punch. Oh well, its not like it really matters does it? I'm guessing since its opening day, they have all or most of their staff on hand so everyone can get hours and proper training before they start handing out hours before, and accommodate the crowd, if and when there is a crowd due to opening day. There was someone who opened the door for us (again I'm guessing this isn't what she was hired for) and we were greeted by I could say 6 hostess. We were promptly seated as there wasn't a crowd (we went in around 4/5ish right before dinner) and our waiter approached us quickly and asked us for drinks. We ended up ordering: Prime Chophouse  And the Customized Red's Tavern Double Crybaby spicy With bottomless fries of course Water was refilled promptly some of the time, the other times the waitress asked if we wanted more water, not too bad, at least she acknowledges that we would like more water as opposed to other places. Burgers were pretty prompt, except for the fact they took like maybe 2 minutes to do a restaurant wide meeting, could of have my burger sooner but why should I rate them down to the death if its just 2 minuets? (some people really really **** like that) To the burger, I haven't had a burger in a long time so this might be that talking but it wasn't too bad, was juicy, and it had almost everything I wanted. My cousin's burger wasn't spicy at all which could be an indicator they need to possibly change the name. There was a funny flavor in my burger that I couldn't pick out but I liked it. It was an enjoyable experience and the fries, although we had to ask was fried really well. They were pippin hot when we got them and that's always a plus. Sauce accommodations is really well done, ask and you shall receive... for most sauces you can think of and it's not an extra charge like some places... (I'm talking about you wing stop, dominos, pizza hut, and all the McDonalds that insist on charging 25 cents for "Extra" sauces). I know we didn't order much, and ill definitely be back to try other burgers. Our bill came out to be just over 22 dollars with tip, not too bad. As we left, there were more patrons coming in and there it was again, 4 people standing in the lobby giving farewells greetings, and the door operator too. :D Why 4 stars then? I don't know, the food just didn't seem to WOW me, just made me go, hmm... not bad. Regardless if they keep up the service, cleanliness, and the food quality goes up, the only way the star rating is to go up.

Man...things really seem different when you reminisce about high school experiences. I remember going to Red Robin when I was younger and thinking it was pretty good. It was a fun atmosphere that served big portions and had numerous crowd pleasing options. Now that my taste have somewhat matured, I really don't enjoy these types of establishments anymore. I went here with a girlfriend and we split a burger, fries, and a shake. The burger was whatever, edible but nothing to write home about.The fries were limp and soggy. The oreo milk shake was yummy but how can you mess up an oreo milkshake? The service was spotty. I don't remember the name of our server..maybe it is because she was absent most of the time..hmmmm?? With all the different food options to try, I'm not a fan of typical chain restaurants and that's exactly what Red Robin is.

We've been a long-time fans of Red Robin's burgers; more recently, their happy hour has lured us through their doors. Their regular-priced drinks are already pretty reasonable ($4.29 for a dirty martini, for example); during happy hour, a vodka & soda is only $2.50 -- what a deal!! As a precursor to our burgers, we found the 3-For-All (with 4 dipping sauces), the Zucchini Sticks, and the Fresh-Fried Mushrooms (under the appetizer menu) tasty! Although there's not much of a view, it's nice having the option for outdoor seating at this location; we never took advantage of dining alfresco at the Tustin Marketplace's location. Staff and service has been great, to date.

I always come here for lunch with all my coworker's today we came as a party of 10 celebrating a birthday , birthday girl is enrolled in their preferred loyal costumer rewards program so she got an email for a  free burger and after we all got our bill the old manager refused to give a $8 burger for free ... Even with the rewards program email ... Didn't wanna argue paid everything. So sad over $8 the old manager got super super fiesty
Pros: Decent burgers and unlimited fries!  Cons: The service here is a bit slow but they are definitely friendly. Overall: Tons of burger choices if you are a burger fan.

Food is decent, as someone said...there is something for everyone. Our server seemed annoyed at something, her attitude was just off.   The current (Oct. 2012) promo for the warm soft pretzel bites can't be missed, they were super good.  The cheese dipping sauce is awesome.  Mozz sticks were great too. I do like to customize my burger here, they are always happy to do so.  My guacamole bacon burger (added onion strings and chipotle aioli) was good and cooked to my request of medium.  Love the fries with a sprinkling of their spices.  The man had a 'shroom burger, he said it was good.

Gluten free buns - gluten free fries! ( separate fryer! Hold the salt)  So i cant tell u how amazing it is for a gluten free eater to be able to get BOTH -BUN and FRIES at one place! Only other place i had this luxury was disneyland!!!! Sure in&out has gf fries but u gotta setttle for a protein burger but noooot here are redrobin!!! HERE u can choose if u want a nice udi bun OR lettuce holding together ur protein! Lots if choices of glutenfree diners iT ALWAYS takesthem awhile to find the GF menu but dont fret they do have one and in the beginning even if i knew what i wanted id Sk for it cuz i felt that it made the server more aware but i just stress the importance tot he staff & ive never been contaminated during my many meals here!

Met my mom here last week during our lunch break from work. Usually at any other Red Robin, if you go during non peak hours you can be in and out very quickly. We met at 2:15pm and had 1 hour. The restaurant was 1/4 filled. We were seated right away and asked what we wanted to eat and drink very quickly (nice)....then the problems began. 1st we both ordered salad and my mom got the soup/salad combo (doesn't take long to make) 20-25 mins later we get our food....btw- we were starving and our waiter never came back during that time.  Once our food came we devoured our plates. Before we were done our waiter brought the check by and we paid since we were in a hurry to not be too late back to work. My mom was finishing her soup and made an ugly face. I asked if she was ok and she spit something out. Then she said it was hard and couldn't chew. She picked it up and examined a HARD PIECE OF PLASTIC in her French onion soup.  We reported it to the waiter who said she would get the Manager. Another 10 mins later he came back and funded my mothers food.  We were both 30 mins late back to work and I don't think my mom will ever go back to a Red Robin or eat French onion soup for a while. I know I will never go back to this one and will definitely avoid the soup!

I love their drinks and appetizers here, but as a vegan, there is only so much that I am able to eat. The servers took a little long to bring me and my girlfriend WATERS, and took a long time to get our food. Upon ordered , I was informed that the fried zucchini appetizer was completely vegan-friendly. NOPE! It has mozzarella cheese inside. I told our server, and she brought us out a freshly made new one as well as a refill on all of our appetizers. The boss man came out and asked us if we were happy now and if there was anything he could do for us. Everything was fine, and after that incident, the servers were all super attentive and filled up our drinks everytime they passed by. When the bill came around, the price was greatly reduced thanks to them taking their mess-up off the final check. So basically, we got a free appetizer. I figured i'd write them a good review because they tried so hard to make sure our time there was pleasant. Our servers were all sweet, caring, and easy to talk to(and look at ;)) Gotta love their wide selection of alcohol, too.

My wife and I love red robin, we usually go to the one near us and its great but were in the area by this one as we had to drive to LAX to collect family.  We arrived just after 6.00 p.m. on a Thursday evening the greeting at the door was subdued, patio looked nice but server to work it was hard to find so changed to inside. Then we had to wait 5-10 minuted to be seated, no one else there waiting but they told us tables were waiting to be cleared, ummm I could see four tables sitting empty and clear. When they did take us to a table it was one of the ones I saw already cleared, funny that. Okay it looked a bit rushed in there and staff was visibly thin although I did see supervisors standing around chatting.  Our server arrived but had at least three tables (including us waiting to be served) so she went to each table taking orders, which meant everyone had to wait for her to cover all of the tables before there orders were put in. I must point out the server (Lauren) was very nice and I just felt she was under a lot of pressure).  Eventually the food cam but we also had a bit of a wait here. I had the royal red robin and my wife the fish & chips. The burger was nice and well presented, the fires were tepid and very limp/soggy, our server had vanished and I was starving so I ate them. My wife batter on the fish was also soggy and the fries the same as mine. Now remember I got the royal red robin which has a fried egg in it and my wife the fish & chips so you generally are going to get your hands messy, no extra napkins, the server did appear halfway through and got us some so she made up points here. After finishing my meal and asked for another serving of fries thinking these ones will be better, nope not at all, in fact you would think they were some of the first batch, barely warm and limp/soggy. Now I could mention it but to be honest we were on a schedule here so did not want to cause more delays. We both gave up on the fires and she did on the batter just removing it to eat the fish. All the staff seemed to be rushing around at a fast pace but I again saw supervisors wandering aimlessly and not helping out, in fact there were kids running around screaming and no one said a word to them. Okay after the messy burger I needed to clean my hands so I headed for the restroom, oh tight space between tables en route, a male server comes and instead of being polite and allowing you to pass first, oh no he just barges through, nothing in his hands. Then when I leave the restroom same thing again with the same server, wow sorry I forgot I was paying to be here. We gave up, paid the bill and left, no one thanked us for both paying or even visiting the restaurant I really got the feeling I was doing them a favor by leaving. Will not visit this location again thank you will got to my local on at Foothill Ranch, CA there you get good service, great food and the managers even come over to talk to you and bring the food out. Leadership starts from the top and I feel this was severely lacking. Wow I paid for this experience thank you red robin at the district for making me feel like I had just gone to MacDonalds. I want to add I hate writing a bad review but when this happens sometimes this is the only was to make then see the problem and correct it plus for others to be warned. If the experience is good I always point it out to the server or staff, we must go both ways on these things. Thanks for reading.

Sooooo this review comes with a caveat. I have recently (VERY recently) given up eating red meat so you may need to take my review with a grain of non burger blood sloshed salt but I will say I've eaten here multiple times previously, so I am a connoisseur of their burgers as well.  My husband has some kind of weird obsession with this place. When given the choice between Red Robin and ANYTHING else, he always goes for the big red cartoon bird. Sometimes I am just unable to fight off his desires so we end up in the plastic booths of this chain restaurant instead of sampling goat cheese and bacon infused dates or whatever else ridiculous food my refined (so says he) palate thinks is edible.  I don't think it's ever been crowded when we come here. The service is always good and efficient. I've never gotten the stink eye from a server or someone too rushed to pay us any attention. They are all very nice. The food is what you would expect from a chain that specializes in "gourmet burgers." I must say as a memo to the marketing department at RR, they should try GDBRO Food Truck burgers and then try telling me again that these things are "gourmet." Ha! But the ingredients are always fairly tasty, especially the Bleu Ribbon Burger and the Whiskey River BBQ Burger.  Where they lose the stars is in their chicken. It became pretty obvious to me that their chicken is precooked and then reheated  when one day I ordered a salad that came with a full chicken breast and not only was it pretty dry but when I lifted it slightly from the plate, the painted on grill marks ceased to show. It also had an "almost chicken" texture. I got the Whisky River BBQ Chicken Wrap as well and ran into the same weird not quite chicken but is really straining itself texture.  I wouldn't advise anyone to stay away from here but if, like me, you've decided to cut back on the red meat, I would suggest another option.

I already gave a 5 star review for this place.  I've never updated a review to write 5 stars again.  This is a first.   To qualify, I only give 5 stars if there is something exceptionally the best about that place... For example:  1) King Taco gets 5 stars for their amazing sauce & quality Mexican food 2) Rance's gets 5 stars for the best Chicago style pizza in the OC 3) Mario Peruvian gets 5 stars cause it's my favorite Peruvian restaurant Now, I'm writing 5 stars (again) for this Red Robin for this one singularity: GREAT SERVICE!!!  For every sit down restaurant of the Chili's, Red Robin, Denny's, Millie's variety... This by far is the best service I've ever come across.   FIRST, I gave a review of this newly opened Red Robin handling a group of 40+ of us.  They were amazing!   This time around I rolled in with like 5 people.  We were sitting next to the bar.  I was there to watch Sunday Night Football.  So, we were camping out for a while.  This guy Hugh, man... he got my drink order.  My drink never hit bottom.  I've never ever ever ever ever had this happen.  I drink like a camel.  Before I finished my drink, he'd come over with another drink.  He did this for 3+ hours.  I must've gotten 7-9 refills.  I wasn't even counting.  He kept refilling.   I didn't order food for like 30+ minutes.  I told him to ignore us while we were gaining an appetite, but he kept coming by to check if we were hungry.   When we got the check, they forgot to include my drink (which was like 7-9 refills of a drink).  We told Hugh & he said it was fine.  We gave him a nice tip of course for the service & to compensate for the drink.   And finally, usually after you pay your bill, you're not getting anymore refills, right?  Well, Hugh still kept coming by to check on us.  He kept refilling us or getting us water.  What the heck?  Hugh!  You are awesome!  Red Robins of the District: You guys are doing a great job!  I'm thoroughly impressed!
Not so gourmet......my burger was overcooked and not very tasty, their French fries are OK.

We came in at around 12pm on a Friday. There were 6 of us and we waited about 10 mins. Our server got to us quick but the food took over 30 minutes to get to our table because there was a "mishap" in the kitchen. Usually, I wouldn't eat here (not my fav) but it was against my will.  I got the whiskey river BBQ burger. Nothing special, fried onion strings in the burger. Came out WARM.   Garlic fries are alright.  Now I feel sick.  happy hour all day everyday, btw.

I love this place! Bottomless fries and ipads on the table for you to wring yourself up, handy if the servers are busy, our server Dave was very attentive. Recommend this to anyone looking for an excellent burger!

This review is purely for my one experience at this location. I came here with a group of 6 total for lunch on a Tuesday.  We were promptly seated at a large booth and greeted by our server who was very nice and polite.  We ordered 2 appetizers, the Onion Ring Tower and Spinach Dip along with our drinks.  Our drinks and appetizers were brought out pretty quickly and our server took our meal orders.  I ordered the Guacamole Bacon Burger, a few of my co-workers order the Royal Robbin, and then the others ordered a chicken sandwich and a regular cheeseburger.  All the food was brought out about 10 minutes later, and our server asked if we needed any condiments.  I asked for ranch, and she quickly brought out 5-6 small ramekins of ranch and then she left and we didn't see her again for at least 15-20 minutes.  In the meantime, my co-worker is eating a burger with a fried egg on it and the yolk form the egg is just oozing out everywhere all over their hands and we have no extra napkins to be found anywhere!  Finally, my co-worker simply got up and went to the restroom to wash their hands because it was so messy!  I once was a server and more napkins is an obvious need with messy food.  Its like serving ribs and handing the patron 1 tiny napkin, it's just common sense.  Other than that mishap the service was fine.  She eventually came back and took our plates and offered dessert, etc. Now for the food, not one of us had fires that weren't overcooked or stale tasting.  The fries were almost hollow they were so well done.  Needless to say a few of us were pretty disappointed, and we couldn't ask for more fries due to our server being missing. Guacamole Bacon Burger: Bland, bland, bland!  Not a sing taste stood out.  The serving amount of guacamole is pretty dismal.  I get more from the Carl's Jr. version of the burger.  The meat had not taste and the cheese was just kind of melted.  Not their best burger, by far! Onion Rings: These were ok, they aren't beer battered so its a little rough on the roof of your mouth.  Dipping sauces that accompany it are pretty tasty. Spinach Dip: Your average spinach dip, kind of bland as well, nothing to write home about.  Mud Pie:  Not sure of the exact name but this thing is ridiculously huge and super frozen when you get it.  I'm not even sure how they cut it, its SOLID when you get it.  If you're a choco-holic then you'll love it. Pros: Friendly Staff Plenty of Seating Good for Large Groups Plenty of menu choices Cons: Guacamole has no taste Burger is not seasoned at all Fries Overcooked No "2-minute check back" done by server Very limited dessert choices
You got a try the crabcakes awesome and great and service very pleased on my little lunch date with my daughter
Been here a few times, they have super slow service and have gotten simple orders wrong. Next time we will drive to another location.

We love Red Robin and this one is one of the better ones to go to. The only disappointing thing is they just changed the rules on the kids menu to not allow refills on the kids mac-n-cheese. I mean really, how much can it cost, it's not even a large amount anyways. But we will still come back.

My husband and I came here on a Saturday for lunch.  We noticed right away that the menu's were dirty,  sticky with food.  He also noticed the condiment tray had food through out the bottom.  It was gross. I ordered a teriyaki pineapple hamburger on wheat, medium.  The burger was overcooked and dry.  It had the texture of cardboard.  My husband said his burger was ok.  His steak fries were undercooked and cold.   Our server would check in one us sporadically.  He was too busy flirting with the hostess to check in on his customers. My husband, who has worked in the restaurant business for over 10 yeara, felt this restaurant was poorly managed.  There were plenty of employees standing around and not even a a lunch crowd on Saturday, they should be wiping down the menus, tables, condiment trays, etc. . We will not return.  We do not recommend.

Went here for dinner yesterday, and despite being newly opened, this location was very nice. We were greeted with a smile as soon as we arrived and everyone was incredibly friendly. When we were seated we only had to wait a minute or so for our server to come by and take our drink and food orders. The food came out promptly and all the food tasted good. I didn't get what I normally got, I decided to try something new. It wasn't too bad, but I think I'll stick to my normal order.  Towards the end of the meal our Freckled Lemonade was starting to become more and more yellow, and less red...maybe they forgot to put the syrup in? Regardless, it was good. When I'm in the area, I'll definitely come back to this one..everyone is just so nice and friendly!
Place was okay. Food is okay. Nothing special. Nothing bad. It was a good late night meal and I do enjoy their endless fries. This place is A-okay
Ordered some good to go tonight. Fries weren't anything special. The hamburger / sandwich item I purchased was made incorrectly.  I remember when Red Robin used to be a good place to eat.

Cheyenne is the best waitress/server/bartender at red robin. Very attentive, she makes sure that you get everything you need. She exceeds all expectations! Just simply an amazing person. Always happy and always has a smile on her face. She knows the menu, drinks, and desserts very well! I would definitely recommend her if she is available!!

Well, my girlfriend and her niece went here expecting a somewhat nice lunch. She said it appeared to not be that busy, yet their food took 50 minutes to get to their table?? Their servers name was James. I myself am a sever, so have much respect for other servers but this is just inexcusable. He also blamed the kitchen! Didn't offer to have the manager come over. Very very disappointed and never coming back again. Made a yelp just to say this.

Came here for my birthday and I come here religiously. However today was the worst experience ever. Rude servers, then I called to speak to a manager and he looked like he came to work in his golfing outfit and had no clue what customer service is. Didn't even bother to find out who's birthday is. Got 2 orders wrong. It literally seems like it's under new management and new staff and they need to go through retraining on what customer service is and how to be polite to people. Also, please no nail polish on servers as half of them are chipping and I don't want to think if some of their nail polish is in my food. Sad to say I won't be coming back here. I will just have to find another location that is better than this one. Oh yeah and I almost forgot, we got dirty plates out. Yuck.

This Red Robin is a rip off!!!  I was overcharged and the manager was supposed to fix my bill.  Oh he fixed it alright, and made me sign the new one, but never submitted it.  the original bill showed up on my account!  How can RR condone stealing?  That's what he did.  Stole from me. Someone's getting all the overcharged dollars. Think about it. This is just one issue I have with RR.  This one was just enough to keep me away from them in the future.  There are plenty of other places to eat.

They advertise Curbside Service but they shouldn't advertise something they don't really provide.  Firstly, try ordering over the phone - if anyone ever picks up, that is. Secondly, other jerk customers need to stop parking in the spots labeled FOR CURBSIDE ONLY. Since this is The District and parking is atrocious, yeah the spots are always occupied. This leaves the option of parking in the nearby TO GO ONLY spots which serve the entire rest of the mall. (Because 2 spots is plenty? Nope.) And they're normally taken too. Good luck. If you park in the TO GO spots, they will never think to look for you there and will therefore never bring out your food. Two times in a row, I called that I was there, told them where I parked and they said it would be another 5 minutes. After 10 minutes, no one showed up. So I called again, hey, where's my food? They said they'd send the manager and to hold on. They proceeded to hang up on me. I watched the door for several minutes but no employee even glanced outside the door. Called again - told the same thing and then hung up on. What the heck? I was being totally polite because hey, mistakes happen, but being hung up on twice? Whatever, decided to walk in. Found the waitress talking about me - "She's called like 5 times but since no one can find her I guess she'll just have to walk in. It's not my problem." Actually, I called 3 times and no one ever came outside, but nice try, lady. They bring my food over (which is now cold) and another waiter tries to tell me that he sent the manager out. "No, he never came out," I said and the waiter went, "Yeah he did, couldn't find you." And I said, "no, I watched the door, no  one ever came out." "Oh, he must be crazy then."  I am not freaking blind and it's not that hard to check the only 4 spots available to pick up food. Is it rocket science? It must be. Right. The manager was standing there chatting with people. C'mon. WHY LIE TO A CUSTOMER? I am not blind. It would be better to say, "we're just so busy" or "we apologize for sucking"  but LYING? Not impressed.  At previous visit I even told the person on the phone where I was parked but they never told the waitress who was left wandering. Point to her - she found me anyway and she deserves a raise.  Sadly this has happened several times now. Our meal was luke warm at best. Service inside the restaurant is fine and the food is normally really good. Just don't bother with curbside because they suck at it and don't support it well at all.

This location is the best in the area aside from my hometown's location in Chino (which is the best) - the portions are great and the service is good. The food takes time to prepare and this place is packed which is to be expected. Food quality is good too.

The burgers were really good and juicy. The fries were alright not super crispy like how I like them but they weren't bad. The freckled lemonade my bf got was really good. The service was a little slow but he wasn't a bad server by any mean so it was fine. If we're in the mood for burgers we would definitely come back.

Went there last night right before our movie. The service was good and the food was outstanding I would highly recommend the southern charm burger. It is one of their new highlighted burgers. my wife ordered the traditional Royal Robin burger and she still enjoys it just like she did the first time. The only reason I am not giving them five stars is because The service was kind of slow. I had to ask them to please refill my water. I understand That sometimes it does get busy but it was 10 o'clock at night and it did not seem that there were many people there. Overall I would highly recommend this red Robin!

I love every single waitress & waiter here , My boyfriend and I are regulars at red robin and everyone is so nice and friendly and is constantly checking up on you, they all have great up beat attitudes and they really make our visit there one to remember thank you guys! Not to mention the wait for our drinks and our food is amazing they get your drinks and food out within 5-15 minutes thanks everyone !!!

Sauteed mushroom burgers!!! nom nom nom. Since RR moved from Tustin Market place to the District, I've only had my burgers to-go. Customer service is great both on the phone and in person. They always get my order right which is more than I can say for other to-go services. Burgers are tasty and generally less than $10. Love their fries too!

I love red robin!! I go very often and always happy with the service. Everyone is friendly the gal at the bar is amazing very nice and attentive. Great beer selection and good happy hour prices  Sometimes we have take out orders and they always give us extra ketchup fries and anything else we might ask for.  The place itself is very clean and organized. I like that they have a section to pick up phone orders vs waiting with everyone else who is waiting to get seated

We came in for dinner. It was a bit busy. No suprise there, so we waited for about 20 minutes to be seated. Hands down the best service I have experienced in a long time. David, our server, was very attentive. Burgers and beer? Can't go wrong. Though our food between the appetizers and the main course took alot longer than usual, I felt staff was always on hand to make sure what the status was. David even came by to apologize for the wait and offered to take one of our appetizers of the ticket. No more than 1 minute after, the manager came personally to our table to apologize himself. We needed to go boxes, and they threw in some fries to go! Will definitely be coming here again. Thanks guys!

I am a patron of Red Robin.  This restaurant in the Tustin District is exceptional, not only for the food, but for the service.  Today, I arrived and was very thirsty.  The restaurant was busy, but Bobby, a server, came up to me immediately and asked if I needed anything.  I asked for club soda and he brought it right away.  It is this kind of attention to customer's needs that makes this restaurant so special. Thanks, Bobby, very much. Professor Michael Fremont Redfield

I'm the 100th review!!! HA HA...ok anyway...I actually hardly ever go to Red Robin...I hadn't been to one in years, but then I signed up for their FREE birthday burger deal. I actually went to another location not far from this one & had a terrible experience.  It was so bad the regional manager comped our meal, re-issued my birthday burger vouched & gave me a gift card...and I was not gonna go back to that one...so I came here & they took great care of me. It ends up that the voucher was not re-issued, but after explaining the whole situation to the waitress, she just got the manager to honor it & apologized on behalf of the other location. So this place really made up for my prior experience.   The burgers are good, great freckled lemonade, and can't beat bottomless fries, which you can order ahead of your meal if you're too hungry to wait! They've also got these new Tavern Fries...it's got Thousand Island sauce, then topped with cheese & bacon...I actually like it better without the sauce...just cheese and bacon for me...but you could ask for it on the side. Overall, a great 2nd chance experience...this location is the only one I'll be coming back to...and still got some left on that gift card!

Melissa and Mason here at red robin were amazing, they made sure that every guest was very well taken  care of. I will definitely be back next time for the outstanding  customer service :) and great food, thank you guys and keep up the excellent work.

I went here with a party of 5 yesterday, and the wait was 15 minutes.  We started with the onion rings, and they were good.  I had the guacamole bacon cheeseburger, which was also pretty good.  I opted for the garlic fries, but the fries were swimming in a garlic butter sauce.  This caused the paper holding my burger to be drenched in this butter making it very hard to eat.  The fries were not good at all.   The server did not check up on us after we got our meals.  I ordered their strawberry lemonade, which was good but came in a very small cup.  After I finished it, my cup remained empty for about half an hour because that's how long it took for him to "check up on us".  By "checking up", I mean that he got us refills on our drinks and water and gave us more napkins (after being asked).  He never once asked us how our food was.  Granted the restaurant was busy, but he passed our table multiple times and never stopped.   Overall, if you want a decent burger, it will do the job.  However, customer service is strongly lacking.

"Meh. I've experienced better." That exactly describes my experience here.  I've always enjoyed Red Robin's burgers. For any of their burgers I could say, "that's a good burger." I've been to a couple of different locations, and their service has always been attentive and timely. For some reason the service at this location was really quite poor. Our waiter took an exceptionally long time to check up on us after our food arrived, and our drinks weren't refilled until we were already almost done with our meal. I would have given 3/5 or even 4/5, too bad the service sucked. The burgers and drinks are all up to par, but for a chain restaurant to stand out, I want to have at the least, timely service. 2/5 is exactly what it deserves. There's definitely room for improvement.

So I came with a friend and we sat at the bar. Our server was David and he was absolutely amazing. He made us the best michelada (bloody beer) I have ever had in my life. He made sure we had everything we needed and even brought our fries out first so we could snack in them. By far this was one of the best dining experiences I have had. Thanks David!!!!!

Been here twice now, and both time for lunch. I like it much better than the old location (Market Place). Parking at the District is much better than the Market Place, especially now that Best Buy is gone.  As soon as you enter you're in the waiting lobby. Hostess welcomed us both times I was there and they even open the door for you as you walk up. Then she takes you to the dining area which (to me) looks a bit smaller than the Market Place location. But the set up is updated. Theres a bar area at one end and a couple of large screen tvs. Its similar to the set up of most BJ's.  The Waitress both times were very nice (different waitress). Automatic refills for drinks without me having to ask. Gave us recommendations - but I normally stick to the Royal Red Robin burger. Food is ok. Not the best burger I've had. On one occasion a bus boy came to our table and asked my nephew if he wanted a ballon, which my nephew replied no thanks. But I thought that was a nice touch when you see children to ask.  Last - you cant beat the loyalty program - buy 9 and get the 10th free (I think thats it) So if you visit RR a lot, make sure you sign up!

I visit this Red Robin about once a month for lunch.  I normally get a burger or chicken sandwich, which are all tasty.  Today I had the new Wolverine Berzerker Burger or something like that.  It had saracha onion strings, spicy pickles, cheese, and a patty that was cooked really well.  Three of us ate here today and the bill was just under $50.  Not bad for a tasty burger, chicken sandwich, fish and chips, and three lemonades! The waitress, Kelsey, was very upbeat and conversational.  I enjoyed her as our waitress and plan on returning to Red Robin next continually.

This review is only for the Happy Hour, which is from 8PM to close!  Not bad at all!  I think they have earlier happy hour from 3-6 also?   Drink and food specials you can't beat!  I tried to order the riblets but the bartender advised me not to... good looking out!  Went with the wings and onion rings... some of the best onion rings and wings i've had in a while =)

I've always been a fan of Red Robin, so when I heard the location at the Tustin MP was closing I was sad.  But when they announced the opening of one at the Tustin District, I was super happy. When I got the invite email for their grand opening, I was over joyed! This location should be better for them and with ample parking, what reason is there for Not going??? - great burgers (and even new ones) - customize their burgers or even make your own - great thick steak fries (must be a new fryer cuz they were amazing!) - endless fries (server kept coming w baskets, as if he had a psychic link w my stomach) - shakes (that you can mix, so go ahead ... ask for a chocolate-banana shake) - quick service (our food was out in less than 10 min) - exactly what we ordered ( no mistakes, no waiting for replacement) Yes ... there are two other burger joints within walking distance ... but with all you get, IMHO ... Red Robin is the best choice.

Been here twice for happy hour. If you've never had their happy hour, take advantage of it! While it is only at the bar (somewhat tough for seating large parties) they still offer the full menu and cheap drinks and appetizers.  The staff is very friendly, and pretty attentive when you need a refill or other requests. I'm happy that this Red Robin opened up since the one at Spectrum can get very busy during peak happy hours.  Also, the bottomless fries are great snacks when you're drinking.

There's been some ridiculously well-marketed burger from Red Robin on a Hulu ad somewhere they're featuring with an egg in it. That was basically what made us want to come here for dinner on a Friday evening. Actually, neither of us ended up ordering that burger. I got a whiskey smoked bbq burger and it was pretty good- I think I still prefer the teriyaki chicken though. We came on a Friday night at 9 PM. There was no wait, as it was past prime dinner time, and we were seated almost right away.  Our waiter was very friendly and came to check on us often. I think his name is Mason. The bottomless fries here are super super delicious! From what it seemed, my burger was made quickly and deliciously and the ingredients were all fresh. i'm not sure if it's just because I came on a good day or because I'm not comparing it to any other gourmet fancy burger place. If you want the Lexus version of a burger, go to The Counter.

Zulma (Or the zulmanator) gave us the best service ever!!! Never once did I think "where is the server?" I would gladly come back to this restaurant as long as she is the server being that she did a fantastic job! Oh, and avoid Artie at all costs!!!! :D
solid 4 star classic cheeseburger and endless fries, no frills just good.  The way a burger should be.

I am actually writing this review as I'm leaving Red Robin.  The food was great. But to be honest, the service is what truly deserved 5 stars. My server, Corey, was clearly very busy and handled it so well! We had a mix up with our order and it was promptly fixed. As a former server myself, I know what it's like to be completely slammed and try to maintain a positive/proactive attitude. She was great.  Black pepper bacon is what's up.

This Red Robin location is nice, clean and huge. Although, they do need more parking spots because they are competing with every other place in The District. Expect it to be crowded Friday evenings.  I ordered the Prime Chophouse.. meh. It was ok. It wasn't that great either. The fried onion bits were soggy and weren't holding together. I noticed that it was a different bun, but it tasted no different. The meat was ok and so were the mushrooms. The service was pretty good. They definitely hired A LOT of people. But it gets a bit annoying when someone comes by every 5 minutes and asks "how's the food?" or "water?" I can tell these guys are trying very hard. But some of the people in the front of the restaurant look so confused.

Everytime I come to this location I am let down. The food always come out cold, pretty bland, horrible service, and so on. When I ordered a salad the lettuce seem old and was not crisp at all. The grilled chicken burger was bland. The chili cheese fries was plain gross: dried, bland,soggy,old. Overall this locations food is jus BLAND! Not a happy customer. I would rather drive 15 mins down the street for the Sunflower location. They are much more upbeat, great cooks, food is always fresh and great service!

I like the whiskey river wrap.  Thought the service was good although there is always that time in the night when they stop refilling your endless fry basket.  Why is that?  The new location is further from my home than before, but it was spangled and new.  Would have liked more fill ups with the water also, but we are in a drought I guess so what are you gonna do?

Seems to be my children's first choice when I ask we're they would like to go. I like the barbecued chicken salad with extra chicken and blue cheese. They also have good burgers, which my children always order

We had a great dinner experience at Red Robin. Our waiter - Evan was the best. We will go back and ask for him again. The Heck-Yeah Hummus Plate was amazing ! Very fresh and tasty. We had wraps, burgers, sandwiches and the shrimp and chicken and the mud pie for dessert. Everyone in our party was very pleased with their meal. The only downside was we did have to wait about 15-20 minutes to be seated but overall it was worth the wait.

Comparing this location to the other ones, this site is definitely not as good as other Red Robins. The Good :] - Endless Steak Fries + Signature Seasoning! - Solid Variety of Gourmet Burgers - Plenty of room, and HD TVs if you're trying to watch sports! - Overall the food is up to par The Not So Good (Comparatively) - Service is a bit on the slow side :[ - Their fries weren't as good as other places :[, I didn't really look forward to having 2nd helpings - The first time I came with a group of 10, we had a really bad experience with a bad smell. We were trying to figure out what it was and if we're not mistaken, it was coming from the bathroom and came through the air vents :[. This was definitely not pleasant D: - Their burgers don't look anything like the picture :[. Sad life. If I want Red Robin, I'd probably go to the Spectrum location instead. This one just lacks what a Red Robin should be :[.

Solid place for a solid burger. A little pricy, but that's the price for quality. Love getting the royal robin (something about an egg just makes the burger that much better!) and their onion rings. Can't get much better  than that!

When we entered, there was no hostess at the hostess stand so we sort of walked around looking for somebody.  Once we found the hostess, she seated us at a booth that was just way too close to the kitchen... It was noisy and quite distracting, however, it was a booth so there's at least that...  Our server took a full ten minutes before actually coming to the table to say hello and ask us for our drink orders.  By that time, we decided to order our drinks, appetizers, and dinner.  We got our items in the following order: Food, Drinks, Appetizers, Forks, napkins, then applicable sauces (Ketchup & Ranch).  I think there might be a disconnect between this location's POS system and their kitchen...  I mean, really, by the time our appetizer came, my husband and I were finished with dinner... By that time, we wanted to have the appetizer cancelled; but she was so inattentive that she left the table without a word!   Another note on our server, she was so quiet that my hubby and I could barely hear her... I can accept that, but I will not accept that fact that she was very inattentive to our section.  The fact that I had to ask for condiments, utensils, napkins, water, AND OUR FOOD. Lastly, the food was really lacking here... When our food finally came out, my husband's bacon burger had one piece of bacon.... And my burger's meat was so well done that it was borderline chewy.... The worst part of the experience was the onion rings... Now I know onion rings are generally greasy, however, these rings were DRIPPING OIL!!! They weren't the perfect crispy/airy morsels that you find at other locations for sure. All in all, this location needs a lot of work.

I've always liked Red Robin, I think it's one of the better chain restaurants we have today. Favorite items include the onion ring tower, Whiskey River burger as well as the Whiskey River wrap. Don't forget to get some aioli as a dipping sauce should you have fries or onion rings, both variations are very good. Freckled lemonade is always a big hit however I think its a little too sweet and overpriced for a lemonade at $4+, however it is bottomless. Service isn't always on par here which is why I'm giving it 4 stars.

Server wasn't very knowledgeable and everything was taking a while, but food came out right and tasted delicious. The steak fries are amazing and bottomless! Love it!!! Burgers are my thing, I'll definitely keep trying different ones!

Well, we gave this location another shot and again were extremely disappointed. My family & I have dined at other locations and this one fails in comparison. Service was terrible, portions were ridiculously tiny, fries were cold & soggy each time, even when we asked for fresh hot ones. Drinks took way too long to be refilled & our waitress ignored us when we needed her most. Love shopping at the District, but we will most likely be dining elsewhere.
Red Robin burgers never dissapoint, and they don't here either. Busy location in the District, service was great too.

We sat down for a family dinner at this location and we so please with the friendly and amazingly fast service. Tonight we had Jeff as our server and from all the times and different locations that we have been to, Jeff was the best server that we ever had. My family doesn't get to spend time together to go out too often so when we do, it needs to be special. I am happy to say that Jeff helped make out family night special.  We had Royal Burger, chicken strips, and whiskey burger. All items were cooked perfect and we wr r en all happy. Thank you Jeff! Thank you Red Robin!

Food was great server had a terrible attitude. Right when we asked for water she stereotyped us. Slammed the water glass on the table when she brought them. Didn't check on us at all. We weren't high maintenance at all just asking for reasonable service.
Happy hour is the best bar tenders know how to make your drink very well .A+ bottomless fries are my favorite.  Appetizers  prices reduced permanently the vibe here  is  awesome .
Thank you Manager Art Jezak for getting back to me about my negative experience. I appreciate your compensation, and will come in to give it another chance!

I enjoy my visit to this location every time I go. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable, and willing to accommodate requests. Prices are OK, and the food is tasty. Their iced tea is never overbrewed or old, which is a huge plus for me. The only downside is that if you order one appetizer and you don't explicitly specify that you only want one, they will automatically double the portion and the price.
Red Robin is a great burger joint to hit up. Drinks are decent as well.
So glad Red Robins got rid of those stupid plastic baskets they used to serve their burgers in, now their using something that resembles a plate. Much better. Kudos to you red robin.

Horrible experience today. The restaurant wasn't even busy and they took forever to serve us our drinks and food. The waitress was mostly to blame as she ignored us throughout our meal- her name is Hollie. Wont be back

This is a second review for red robin. I had a horrible first experience but they remedied the situation and that's a huge plus to me. The fact that they actually took the time to respond to my review means a lot. I give them 4 stars for that and hope they get some quality servers for their good.

This is a perfect location for a Red Robin since we live very closeby. My husband and I come here just for the bottomless fries and lemonade when we have the munchies. The servers don't pressure you into ordering an actual meal. I am always torn between the A1 Peppercorn Burger and Whisky River Burger. I love some of their dipping sauces (Campfire and Spicy Thai) for the fries. Servers are always friendly and attentive. Food and drinks arrive promptly. Parking is never an issue. My husband and I love having muchies nights here!

Came in tonight for dinner and was assisted by Christina or Christine. She was very rude from the beginning and was very in attentive. We placed our order approximately 2 minutes after being seated and this is when the trouble started. For the next 20 minutes we were ignored and our waiter served people who had arrived after us and continued to pay us no attention. When our food arrived it was cold and she brought no utensils. I didn't feel like waiting for new food and asked for our check. We had Melissa one of the managers come out and she apologized. She was very nice and professional this is something our waiter should've noticed and start implementing in her daily routine.

i just go for their whiskey chicken bbq sandwich and BOTTOMLESS fries!!!  also, their strawberry lemonade drink is pretty good (if you like a sweet yet refreshing drink), and that's also unlimited refills as well, but don't order too many refills otherwise you'll get full easily from munching on your meals and fries.

Gourmet?  I truly doubt it.  For $10, I expect more than meat, some toppings, and a bun taken from a bag.  At least toast the buns!  I ordered the bleu burger and it was average at best.   I actually think a fast food joint like Jack in the Box provide better burgers.

My first negative experience with this location was with a gal named Paula.  She was inconsiderate, rude, and truly not suited to work the service industry.  She offended many people in my party and ruined our evening.   Our second visit to this location was almost as bad, and after tonight I am fairly certain I will never return to another Red Robin location ever again. Our visit started with a grumpy gentleman.  He was not pleased to see us, nor did it look like he wanted to be serving us at all.  We all ordered our food and waited.  Upon the arrival of the food, it became apparent that my boyfriends burger was missing.  The food runner went to go see where it was.  Our server came by halfway during our meal and also went to go see what was happening with the burger.  Towards the end of our meal he said "Okay, we tracked down the burger for you, should be out shortly."  (We much would have preferred an honest "I forgot to put it in" or a "Our kitchen skipped the ticket" than some clearly BS excuse)  As we finished our meal, the server walked around the general area of our table, checking to see if the burger had arrived.  We were finished with our meals and had stacked plates near the edge of the table.  Still, no burger.  The server seemed to be too embarrassed to walk near our table, so every single cup on the table remained empty, begging for refills.  A busser came by to take our plates, mistakenly taking someones drink as just a dirty glass.  Finally a guy in our party had to track down the manager as we had finished a while ago, and were still waiting.  The manager was very nice and apologetic when the burger finally came out.  We then had to request from him everything we wanted (refills, a glass replacement, more food, etc) as our server still failed to show.  The one thing that saved the night was the manager's sincere apology and the fact that he took the final burger off our check.  We still tipped 20% off the original check price as we gave the server the benefit-of-the-doubt... maybe he was just having an off night?  Though 6/7 of us seriously doubted that, nevertheless 20% was given. The table's only pet peeve with the manager was that when he filled our glasses, he touched the rim of the pitchers to the rims of the glasses.  Contaminating other people's glasses (we do not all use straws) with mouth-germs from other strangers in the restaurant is a pretty serious offense - especially  with such a serious flu outbreak going around - and it seemed like a very careless mistake. Save your money- avoid the Red Robin chain.  If you do want to go out, support local businesses (Gourmade, Mick's etc).  Service is much better since they have much more to lose than a corporate chain that hires any average GI server off the street.
We ate lunch at this establishment when they opened at 11 am. Great service in a timely manner. Server name was ( Natalie ). Great server and would recommend asking for her section.

I ate at the bar tonight. I usually don't like eating at bar counters because I feel uncomfortable. The bartender was absolutely incredible. He made me feel comfortable, he even got me talking and laughing after a long day at work. He deserves to be recognized and rewarded. Food was great as always, love the shakes here! Service went above and beyond tonight. Very happy customer.
Paola is a great server! She was on top of everything and made the night so enjoyable. I love personable servers that give me a entertaining evening at dinner! Thanks Paola, we'll be back for sure!

One can't go wrong with Red Robin.  I mean come on!! Bottomless fries!! Yes please.  Our server Michael was really cool.  I could tell he enjoyed working there.  He joked around with us and he made sure we were taken care of.  My chicken tenders were great.  The fries seemed to be a bit underdone.  I like a little crunch in my fries.  My friends inhaled their burgers, so I can assume that they loved them.  I am bummed that I have to drive all the way down to the district to get my Robin fix but I digress.  Highly recommended.  The only thing keeping the last last away were the underdone fries.  Note to the manager(s), please leave them in for another few seconds to get them to a nice golden brown.  See you next time!!

Good classic burger place with good food. The whiskey BBQ burger is one of the better ones on the menu. The server tonight was pretty good. She was at tentative without being annoyingly so. Overall a good place to visit again.

Why oh why did you move!??! We loved going to Red Robin during the work week for lunch when it was at the Tustin Market Place. Now, they are located in the zoo of a place, Tustin District. The parking lot is HORRENDOUS! Other than that, it's like any other Red Robin. Delicious bottomless fries and good burgers. Like their flavored ice teas too.
Perfect!! Come here if you want to meet with friends or family when you are starving! Great customer service!

Went there for lunch today with a large work party and wasn't impressed with the food. My sandwich had one piece of deli meat and one slice of bacon on it. Iced tea and my sad sandwich totaled $15. Definitely won't be going there again.

My boyfriend and I just got done with our meal here, and besides the location, I have to say that this was by far my best experience at a Red Robin restaurant (and I go quite often.) It is after all a Friday night and therefore rather busy. Luckily there was an available table at the bar so we sat there. The bartender Ian was awesome. Bottom line. Best Bloody Mary ever. The food was on point and so was the service. For being busy, everything came out quickly and was so delicious. I was more than pleased with our experience here and will continue to come to this location from now on.

I came here with my family after my brother graduated from the fire academy. We had the best service ever! Especially since we had multiple people in a group and our check needed to be split. David provided exceptional service, he was very attentive to our needs and went above and beyond for us. Thank you David we are so very thankful for your hard work.

Their burgers are good and expensive. I got whatever burger comes with blue cheese and fried onions...it was delicious. I also got a chocolate malt...I had them make me a new one because it hardly tasted like there was malt in it. We ended up getting the first malt free which was nice. I don't know how much I crave expensive burgers like this...In n Out can usually do it for me but I will be back when that expensive burger craving strikes again :)

This review is based on the service at this location and not on the food. It's a chain so you can expect the food to be similar to other locations. With that said, about the service: we came here on a Friday afternoon and the restaurant had people in it but was by no means full. Still, we waited a couple of minutes for a table. The host was nice and so was our server but it took awhile for her to even come by and take our drink orders. We were on a bit of a time constraint so this was an immediate turn off. next, our food also took awhile to arrive, which was surprising because there was pretty much no other parties in our section. But what really displeased me was how slow our drinks were refilled. Our server literally didn't come back to our table until we were almost done with our meal. To make matters worse, the manager walked by our table, saw that our drinks were empty but then walked away. I know it's not his job but a good manager would have recognized this. I love red robin so I will probably be back but staff....please step up your game!

This was my first time at this location, but have zero plans of ever returning. We walked in tried the patio first but after too many screaming kids, decided to venture to the bar. Sat down for ten minutes, not so much as a hello, I'll be with you shortly, nothing! The bartender walked back and forth literally twenty times, looking at us, and finally walked away, still no service.My Lady and I were dressed nicely, but still ignored,  so after zero acknowledgement , zero contact, we left and pursued other eatery's to quench our thirst on this hot Saturday afternoon.

The royal red robin burger is the best burger I have ever had. Add that with bottomless fries and you have one happy camper. I always wanted to try something else but cannot order anything but the royal red robin burger.
Great salads at a burger joint - southwest is the best!

Did have have a management change at this place? I went there for dinner last week and noticed that are different from my previous visits: - I order the burger well done but the meat is pink. - Server never came by to check if we want refill on our drinks or more fries.

mushroomie room, Royal Red Robbin, and chicken salad, are the tastest, especially with Spinach Artichoke...yum-me! but have never had a bad meal here yet!  15+ years! There is always a greeter/seater, great for kids, sports channels Galore!  A excellent select of drinks.. Nostalgia all over the walls, no bad seating, but your timing to get in is critical, so always think early or most of the time 14-20 min wait! Most of all any food for your palette

Came here on a sunday about noon, there was no hostess when we walked in, a few minutes of waiting in the front somebody came up and put our name on the list. There were about 25-30 seats open and the hostess had us wait for about 10 minutes to sit us (party of 4).  The servers seemed under-trained and poorly managed. I did not see a manager throughout the entire visit, there should be a manager in the front of the house 24/7 to keep staff accountable, tend to needs of customers and help run the front. Poor management.  The food took quite a long time (30 min or so) for a lunch that is a bit of a wait for red Robbin.  food was good, drinks were good, service lacked skill (not trained fully) Not happy with this visit, i will try it again to see if they improove their management.
Had a horrible experience. Waited for more then 15 minutes for service, no one ever came.  Had to call the attention of a server to acknowledge I was waiting for service. Never coming back again.
Great food and great prices. My wife and I have had the pleasure of having Dominic as our waitress twice.
I have loved RR for years.  Superb place to take kids, but with good food and drinks for the adults.  Lots of options and good flavors.

For the longest time I always associated Red Robin with Round Table Pizza. Red Robin-Round Robin-Round Table. Most of this was because the nearest location was 20+ miles from me and ate there so rarely. I always see the commercials and feel out of the loop on the RR culture with the whole "yum" hum but frankly either ignored or didn't see that for years the way they make us feel we all should. Initially I thought the chain to be somewhat like "chilli's" with their  ribs association I too figured the burgers here would be amazing, but as we all know Chilli's ribs are not the business and Red Robin burgers just can't compete with the 2011 Burger revolution. It's as if the whole world became burger connoisseurs overnight. No longer will mediocre ingredients be acceptable as by now most everyone has had an excellent burger that blew away years and even decades of old cooking thinking. That may seem harsh, but when you look at the rest of the menu here it's actually quite good.
