For a chain restaurant they have very consistent and good sides, entrees and appetizers, obviously there is no executive chef making everything from scratch, and they do manage to step away from the whole "waiting" cloak as they are somewhat kid friendly, yet they are able to keep the rif raf boozers apart from any innocent bystanders by sheer architecture and layout unlike other places. It's a large location that's clean and new. Service is usually impeccable at all locations and my first few times here they lived up to the billet, but my last experience was sub par. Just slow, I mean I'll give them that they get packed because The District can be a pile sometimes and parking can suck a bit, but over 2 hours during HH I waited half the time for drinks and ended up moving to Dubliner and then to sushi for dinner. I actually would have loved to stay and eat there and the reason we left Dubliner was it was too bar foodish. If your thinking of eating and a Chilli's or Applebee's, try Red Robin first. If your looking for a good burger, look elsewhere because the flavor profiles are great here, but it's a new era and burgers and food in general. Red Robin is to burgers what Shock Top is to beer, better than domestic coors, but not craft enough to hang with a micro.

SOMETHING ON THE MENU FOR EVERYONE Although there's a good selection of fresh and interesting salads, Red Robin is a carb haven starting with the thick-cut, bottomless fries that come with every sandwich! Many appetizer choices, including smokin' deals during happy hour Monday - Friday. Chose a winner with the fried mushrooms along with the towering onion rings, while the cheese sticks were just a little too bready. What makes this run of the mill, brightly-colored, kitchey-decorated, family chain restaurant stand out is their many choices. Hamburgers, chicken sandwiches, and with a variety of buns including classic sesame, whole grain, onion, ciabatta, or jalapeno-cornmeal kaiser. With a minimal up charge sides and add-ons include sweet potato fries, fruit salad, coleslaw, black beans, veggies, and mac n' cheese. The Whiskey River Chicken Sandwich is my favorite choice; crispy straw onion rings, shredded lettuce, juicy tomato, and an extra side of barbecue sauce, please.

I go to lunch there several times a month.  Each time I have visited the service has been awful.  Not sure if it is just a new staff or they don't care.  The food is always good but it takes forever to get your food.
Love their burgers and steak cut fries.  Dislike dirty televisions at the bar area and the women's  bathroom not being stocked at the dinner hour.
This location used to be good. Last two times we have been service was terrible and food was cold or just not good. They are always busy and you can tell they can't handle the rush.

I've been to a few Red Robin's, but my meal here definitely stands out and was probably one of the best I've had at this chain of restaurants. I was able to go with my group of friends recently, and the service that we had here was definitely topnotch. Our servers would check up on us (though it WAS hard to get their attention sometimes), and were definitely friendly. Another thing they did well was making sure that our orders (we all had separate checks and very specific food requests) were all correct. So far, so good, and I haven't even gotten to the food itself yet! I ordered the California Chicken Sandwich (hold the pickles and the bacon, substituted the chicken for a vegan patty, and had a wheat bun instead) and, even though the sandwich was sort of messy to eat, it was still very delicious and satisfying. Something else that was also very tasty was the endless fries (our server was even kind enough to bring out all the sauces they offered, and my friends and I had lots of fun trying the different dips). The second basket of fries always tastes better, hint hint (:  Good food. Friendly service. Endless fries, YUM!

Everything tasted amazing.  There was no wait and our server was quick about getting us our dinner.  I'm pretty sure we're going to make this our new Red Robin from now on, even if I have to drive longer to get here.
Just what you'd expect from a Red Robin. Parking on a Friday night is TERRIBLE, so keep that in mind. Otherwise the experience is on par with other locations.

I am confused about how this place has such good ratings. My boyfriend and I were cranky-hungry and near The District.  He described the quality of Red Robin as being on par with Chili's or something like that which sounded good enough for how hungry I was feeling.  He got the gourmet cheeseburger and said the actual meat was good but the sauce and other toppings were meh.  I had the veggie burger.  The description mentioned seasoned zucchini, grilled onions, and a balsamic sauce atop the burger (moringstar) which sounded kind of delicious. The actual burger was topped with three hot, tasteless, steaming zucchini spears and the balsamic sauce just tasted tangy.  Additionally, just because the fries are thick doesn't mean they are good.  I'm pretty easy going with food and this was hands down one of the worst meals I've had in a while. So if you find yourself at The District... Meat eaters- Head to In-N-Out Burger or Five Guys Vegetarians- Native Foods or Whole Foods

lunch with coworkers...sat outside as it was pretty busy in the dining room.  Our server Evan was great!  Attentive, detailed and enthusiastic!  Food was as to be expected (Onion rings, fries, mushroom burger, and a root beer).  Will definitely come back again!

Bad service. Bad food. This place blows. I got a better burger at Carls jr and better service at a self serve gas station. The burger sent me straight back to the 3rd grade lunch line, with fries that were so over done that they nearly cracked a tooth! The manager lurked around hovering over people and not doing anything other than making us uncomfortable. Dreadful. Lesson learned. You can learn from our mistake and avoid this poor excuse for a restaurant.

I went to eat lunch with coworkers at this red robin. Service wasn't the best but it was lunch time and getting busy. I ordered the crispy chicken salad and a peach ice tea. We got our food everything was fine until a few pieces of my chicken appeared to be raw inside. No one came to check on us until both my coworkers were done eating. I told them that my chicken was raw and the waitress said ill take that and left. The waitress came back a few minutes later and asked if I wanted another salad and I said no I'm no longer hungry then she left again. The manager came by after a while and said "I really don't know what to say," I gave my cooks a talking too and can I get you anything else." I replied no I'm no longer hungry. Why the 3 stars? Well basically, a coworker and I decided to beat the lunch rush and go to lunch at 11am since we only had an hour for lunch. Parking was a breeze and we were seated promptly. We made sure to order quickly so that the food could come out that much quicker. After 30 minutes of waiting (in a nearly empty restaurant), we asked our server to check up on our order. She responded that they had a lot of phone orders that needed to be taken care of but assured us that ours would come out soon. Our food came out 40 minutes after we ordered it .. and 5 minutes AFTER the table next to us got their food (although they came in 15 minutes after us). At this point, I think I was just annoyed because we both got the sandwich and soup combo which shouldn't take 40 minutes to make. I know that servers should treat all customers equally but I think it's pretty clear to see that some customers are more pressed for time (aka those in business casual clothes) than those that are there with their family and friends. I enjoyed the food as much as I could since we were already running late at this point. When we were ready for our check, our server was nowhere to be found and we literally had to stand up and walk around to ask someone for our check. I'm not expecting to come and go within 40 minutes in a sit down restaurant but waiting 40 minutes for a sandwich and soup at 11am was just a little too ridiculous for my liking. I am sure I will return here eventually but will definitely NOT be trying to stop by during my lunch hour .. unless I place a phone order.
